description:
This location is really close to my friend's home so after a long morning, we wanted to go somewhere near by and eat something that wouldn't be too heavy. We went at around 3PM so there was no one there. And since it was empty, we were seated right away. The server was attentive and all the food came out within about 15 minutes. It's a decent sized restaurant (about 8-9ish tables and seats  an average of 4 people per table). And although it was a random time, more people started coming in to eat at around 3:30PM.

We ordered the gyoza ($6.50), croquette ($5.95), the Scallop Delight Roll ($14.95), and the Bobby's Roll ($13.95). The gyoza was deep fried. I usually don't like deep fried gyoza but this was actually pretty good. It wasn't too oily and the meat and vegetables inside were delicious. Next, the croquette was AMAZING. They don't make it there but it was DELICIOUS. The potato mix inside was a combination of potato and a little bit of carrot; and it was perfectly fried. 

Now for the rolls...the Scallop Delight Roll was really good. It wasn't heavy at all which made it even better. It had shrimp tempura, cucumber and avocado inside and was topped with spicy scallop and tobiko. And the Bobby's Roll had avocado, cucumber, and minced tuna, and topped with salmon, spicy mayo, and tobiko. This was also a really light roll. 

This meal was the perfect amount for 2 people to share. To top it off, rather than getting candy with the check, they gave Yakult! I was so surprised they were giving these out for free. It was the perfect top off to our meal. Overall, I would definitely return and recommend this spot!
author: Victoria H.

description:
Definitely the best sushis of SF!!!
I love this place! Everything is so good and fresh!
I used to come here every week when I was living in SF.
Service is really good! You can find lots of choices for California Rolls but also some bento box and other meals. 
I am really surprised this place is not in the top 3 of SF. It really should be.
author: Nawel C.

description:
Usually don't write negative reviews...but I rely on yelp reviews. Let's make this simple and short...

I love Japanese food...and sushi is my definitely go to. Their sushi is not fresh. Their bento
box portion was tiny and their menu was pretty  pricey compared to most Japanese spots.

...lastly, when we requested a refill on water...the waitress brought out a jug and set it on the table for us to pour ourselves. 

That. Is. All. :)
author: crissy c.

description:
Came in Friday night for dinner with my GF. There were a few people in the restaurant, so we headed in to give it a try.

We ordered a bunch of rolls. All of them were pretty good.

The service was super fast and friendly. We never had an empty glass!!! Perfect!

They also have us a ton of free food/compliments of the chef! 

Overall a great neighborhood gem to check out!
author: Robert R.

description: The bento box was filling and a lot of food for $11. The beef teriyaki was a little on the sweeter side, but excellent with rice, and the ton katsu was crispy, with a great texture and flavor with the dipping sauce.
author: Alice Z.

description:
My boyfriend and I came in a little before 3 for a late lunch however service was a snail's pace. After about 15min, we finally got water and put in our order for the Katsu Don, Beach Roll, 8pc Nigiri, and a Small Hot Sake. The Katsu Don came out within 5 min but we had to ask several times for the other items. After the second time of asking, they finally gave us the Sake. The Beach Roll came out 20 min after we ordered, and the Nigiri took 30 min to come out. I'm incredulous over the fact NIGIRI from the standard selection took 30 min to come out.

Quality of food is mediocre at best. The miso soup given was grainy at best. For the Katsu Don, it's large at least so at least you get a lot for the cost but the slowness of the service made me lose my appetite. The Beach Roll was essentially a California Roll with shrimp, mayo, and eel sauce on top. The Nigiri was fine, but again, Nigiri should not take 30 min to be served.
author: Eumin L.

description:
A friend was visiting from out of town and said he was craving sushi. My boyfriend and I have our usual spot in our own neighborhood, but lately we've been trying to branch out and try new things. I went with my gut (after looking through the menu) and decided to ignore the star rating on this one because I know that our usual place (which I love) also doesn't do well by yelp standards.
I am so glad that we decided to give this place a try. The food was great and the service was excellent. We even got a complimentary appetizer roll. We had the dynamite roll (only two bites left in the picture), lion king roll (not pictured because we devoured it so fast), the Las Vegas roll, and the bay bridge roll. We also ordered the tempura ice cream for dessert.

Our least favorite things were the Las Vegas roll (a little too cream cheesy) and the tempura ice cream ( just not as good as Mexican fried ice cream IMO), but we still finished everything set before us. 
For a group of three, 4 rolls plus a dessert was perfect portioning. 
It was easy to find parking and it was an overall cozy little spot. Blew our neighborhood sushi joint away!
We will be returning that's for sure!
author: Chelsea A.

description: It was so disappointed. I ordered the Oyako Don as usual. But it tasted bad today. The chicken was not fresh at all. And their salad was not taste like usual.
author: Crystal T.

description: A lot of food for a good price. It was quiet when I ate lunch there and there's plenty of space for larger parties.
author: Mario H.

description:
I love this place!! The staff is always so kind and welcoming. I'll just list some of my usual favorites :

Spicy tuna roll (one of my favorite places to enjoy this roll)
Crazy monkey roll 
49ers roll (so refreshing with that tiny lemon slice on top) 
Beef udon 

Grinch roll (recently tried it & love it) 


******The oysters were disgusting though. I think they use oysters that are meant for grilling not the ones you shuck & eat raw.
author: judy c.

description: I was trying to find a good place with good sushi most of the place on the street didn't give me what did I get here The service was amazing and the food I give that 10 stars.
author: Eli E.

description:
Although I don't generally spend a lot of time in this part of the Richmond, I used to be kind of curious about Balboa Teriyaki.  A few friends who grew up nearby and came here as kids would speak rather fondly about them, but I never knew if it was because the food was actually good or just nostalgia.  Now, after having tried them, I can only assume it was due to the latter because, otherwise, I might have to start questioning their taste in Japanese food!

While my first trip here was more than enough for me to evaluate Balboa Teriyaki, the (anal) Yelper in me felt compelled to give them another shot.  Not so much in the spirit of being thorough, but because my friend made the unfortunate point that I didn't actually try their namesake teriyaki dishes.  Ugh.  Fortunately though, I didn't have to worry about repeating everything all over again, as the menu is decently varied, albeit with standard offerings (small plates, sushi, sashimi, bento boxes, udon, etc.).

**I heard that the prices may have changed, so these may not be accurate anymore.

-- HAMACHI NIGIRI...$5.50
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/balboa-teriyaki-san-francisco?select=58QJUpWbZpjqT55-BXIf-g)
Possibly the best thing I had, which might not be saying much.  While it was a sizable piece, the cut of the fish was a bit awkward (there was a big tendon down the middle) and it had a small dollop of minced ginger, which I'd never seen before.  Still, it tasted fine and was decently fresh, so I can't complain too much.

-- GIRL BOY ROLL - Shrimp Tempura, Cream Cheese, and Avocado topped with Tuna, Salmon, Eel Sauce, and Tobiko...$13.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/balboa-teriyaki-san-francisco?select=_O5ERmHKqzpBQIii4xceSw)
Even though all of the components naturally complemented each other, this didn't really stand out.  The salmon wasn't too shabby, and the avocados were ripe, but the tuna didn't do much for me (almost tasteless).  As for the tempura, I didn't care for the texture of the batter (kind of mealy), though it tasted okay.

-- POKE SALAD - Assorted Sashimi, Daikon, Seaweed Salad, Spring Mix, Kaiware, Cucumber, and Tobiko topped with Special and Spicy Sauces....$13.50
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/balboa-teriyaki-san-francisco?select=99ju2z61n4r1UEZLP023VA)
The order was a lot larger than I had expected, but nothing special otherwise.  Although they were fairly generous with the portion, the fish didn't seem especially fresh (they definitely weren't prime cuts).  Then again, the sauce might've had something to do with it, as it was pretty sharp/acidic.

-- DINNER BENTO BOX - Chicken Teriyaki, Chicken Katsu, and Gyoza...$16.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/balboa-teriyaki-san-francisco?select=KIt3bDAsjtONbAPvFGQjFQ)
To be honest, the chicken teriyaki was easily the worst thing I had.  It didn't have much of a char, it tasted like it might've been previously frozen, and it was sprinkled with seaweed (??).  The katsu was slightly better, if only because #fried, but the breading was paper thin.  As for the gyoza, they weren't awful, but they weren't exactly special either (ditto for the salad and miso soup).

-- ORANGE DRAGON ROLL - Shrimp Tempura and Cucumber topped with Salmon, Spicy Mayo, Unagi Sauce, and Tobiko...$12.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/balboa-teriyaki-san-francisco?select=dMLjN6hACaEV66Pqz_lHqw)
It wasn't part of the plan to get a roll so similar to the Girl Boy one, but it felt like a relatively safe choice.  Though the salmon wasn't bad, nothing else was that great.  Sadly, we ran into the same problems with the shrimp tempura (though it was tastier this time).  Plus, it had carrots in it, which was kind of odd.

Also, I can't say I was a big fan of their sushi rice in either the nigiri or the rolls.  Both times, it was almost flavorless and had a gummy sort of consistency.  That said, despite the disappointing food, neither meal was a complete failure.  Service was consistently friendly and they gave a free appetizer with each meal - a fried ball of salmon (I think...) and a grilled shrimp skewer (https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/balboa-teriyaki-san-francisco?select=OFvh4QaVeAM0O3CwMseweQ).

All in all, despite the service and the free food, neither was enough for me to give anything more than two stars.  Maybe if I had some old memories to go with them, but alas...I don't.  Sorry.
author: Mike L.

description: This is the friendliest locals spot. No pretension or trendy factor. Easy to get a seat and chill on a Friday night. Old school vibe, but also tidy. Lots of rolls to choose from. They threw in a little amuse bouche. I'd run back if given the choice.
author: Andrew K.

description:
The food tastes good. The bill was WAY OVER PRICED. I can accept when restaurants are a little overpriced. Happens all the time. But when the beanto boxes came, not only were they overpriced, the portion was less! Meat is cut thinner than compared to any Japanese restaurants I've been to. Fish was half the size of what any other Japanese restaurants I've been to. Don't get me stared in the Sashimi. Take a look at the pictures I've uploaded. That bento box had so little amount of food on it that it felt like we were eating someone's half eaten bento box. Originally, I kept that overpriced and skimmed portion to myself. But once we left, that was the consensus. Everyone thought the restaurant was overpriced and the amount of food they give you was way too little. Restaurant over pricing and cutting corners. 

I would have given this a 2 star, however, the food tasted good and the customer service was okay. That night we went there to eat, the bathroom was out of order. Anytime any customer needed to goto the restroom, the waiter would give them a flashlight. Seriously, how does one wipe while holding a flashlight. Or do anything in the bathroom with a small plastic blue battery powered flashlight. 

If you want Japanese, goto another restaurant, if your lazy to travel, you can get here and NOT get what you paid for.
author: Jack L.

description:
This place was TERRIBLE! 

I attempted the most simple order possible and they still managed to make it bad.

I asked for: 

negihama maki (yellow tail + scallions), and got a roll with yellow tail, flavorless scallions, burdock (the weird tasting carrot look alike), cucumber, and it had ponzu sauce on it. THAT IS NOT NEGIHAMA MAKI, and the menu didn't mention any of those ingredients either. 

Spicy tuna: not good. I had to add a LOT of wasabi to make it somewhat appetizing.

Salmon maki (should be just salmon, rice, seaweed), and I asked to add scallions. 

I got my rolls, and there were scallops in the salmon maki (not to mention the burdock again and ponzu sauce). I called the waiter over to ask about the scallops, and told him, "I said SCALLIONS." "What's that?" He asked. Who doesn't know what scallions are? Especially someone who works in a Japanese restaurant?? 

Nothing tasted great, two out of the three rolls had multiple ingredients added that were not on the menu (nor in the standard preparation of said rolls). I left three out of 15 pieces behind. I will NEVER be back!
author: Jessica C.

description: Had my daughters birthday here and while it was small they accommodated us with ease. The food was good and sushi was average. Ran about $35 per person with tip and saki....
author: Paul D.

description:
SOOOO Family Friendly - we were one of I think 4 families there tonight

Their SF Roll : Eel, REAL crab, Avocado, SO FRESH AND WONDERFUL
BEST EVER.  They told me they use REAL crab for every special roll :)

Bento: 
Saba shioyaki  tender and not too salty
Kid devoured the salad and rolls
Decent Chicken Katsu

Wonderful Customer service and free little appetizers and yogurt drinks at the end.
Thank you for being our neighborhood GOTO place. consistent quality each time and great wait service, plus a place we can bring a noisy child and not feel like a nuisance.
author: Win H.

description: Good food. Sashimi is fresh. For lunch, the bento box with several options (no substitution) are available and is the best deal for about $11.
author: Ry T.

description: Came in because I had a MAD craving for teriyaki. My friend and I both ordered two bento boxes: 1 with teriyaki chicken + katsu chicken, 1 with salmon + sashimi (super duper small portions for the sashimi!!). The teriyaki chicken was on the dry side and the katsu was just a-ok. For $10.50 per bento box, I think that is a pretty fair deal if you're simply stopping by for lunch. Don't expect tooooo much...
author: Mary L.

description:
Rolls were good. They gave us tiny nice things like free appetizer and dessert.. 
Don't really know  why this place has only 3.5 stars... Not fair!:)
author: Karyna Y.

description: Sushi only spot.  Nothing else.  There is a small selection of appetizers but this is strictly sushi rolls.  we were the only ones in the restaurant at 5:30pm and came here with little ones.  It was alright.  The tempura could've been better and sushi rolls were just ok.  Service was good though.  Food, eh.
author: Jill P.

description:
It is very good place for a lunch or dinner.We were with all my family. All food was fresh and delicious.
I ate sukiyaki- 
Waiter was very friendly.
author: Eva K.

description: Great selection of rolls and good service. Double hamachi is my favorite :) Overpriced sashimi,  you pay $14 for a five tiny pieces :(
author: Roman L.

description: New to the area and have eaten here twice. Service wasn't very good, and was overcharged the first time. Gave it another chance yesterday and again, terrible service, and our bill was a different price after ordering the exact same thing. After eating here both times, a friend and I both got sick with 20 mins of leaving. I'm pregnant so I thought it may have been pregnancy related the first time, but twice doesn't seem right especially with others also becoming ill. The stack of app plates on the table were filthy and unsanitary, as well as the soy sauce dishes, and drinking glasses. I won't be going back, which is sad considering there aren't many options in the area.
author: Ashley K.

description:
Spur of the moment to get some udon and disappointed.
Not up to par. Price to quality and quantity is on opposite scales.
Think twice.
author: David H.

description:
Was really feeling Japanese and this place was recommended to me. However, that recommendation came from someone who tried it quite a while back. 

The portions were pretty disappointing, and did not warrant a $15 meal (even for lunch!). The restaurant literally had one other table with customers, but the service was still extremely slow, mostly because the waiter was just standing behind the register on his phone the whole time, and we had to repeatedly ask for more tea/water. I probably won't be trying this place again, seeing as there are plenty of other Japanese restaurants in the Richmond that are a lot better.
author: Ryan C.

description:
I can't believe how overpriced their sushi is, you are better off going to other sushi
restaurants. Expect to pay $6 or more for 2 pieces of nigiri sushi. Not sure why the costs are so high, must not get a lot of business. Usually escarole costs around $2 but it cost $6.50 here. The quality is extremely lacking for what you're paying for. Also, my ikura nigiri tasted spoiled. The waitress tried to tell me that it was not and that it was fresh since they just opened, but I've tried ikura at many places before and it shouldn't have a foul taste. Please don't try arguing with your customers. Needless to say, I will never come back. The restaurant itself also looks unkempt. Please save your money and get your sushi fix elsewhere.
author: Deanna O.

description: Stopped in for a quick bite a drinks to kill time before a movie at the theater next door. Wasn't expecting much, but was pleasantly surprised by the warm service despite arriving 30 minutes to their close time. The same was nice, and they offered us a tempura treat on the house to start. Ordered a rainbow roll -- amazing!! Best rainbow roll I've had. Definitely coming here again.
author: Aimee L.

description:
I came here for lunch with a couple of friends.  I haven't been back in awhile.  We got a seat in the booth and it was clean - no food on the booths.

I ordered the lunch bento of tonkatsu and tempura.  You get a big honking bowl of rice and salad with your bento. I could have sworn the meal came with soup but we weren't given any miso soup.  The tempura and tonkatsu were fried perfectly.  

They threw in some endame and fried salmon balls as an appetizer.  They also gave us free green tea ice cream (maybe to make up for no soup?).

Service was good. The lady was very nice.  Not bad.
author: Wendy H.

description: Very distraught and bothered that they advertise sushi as having "real crab",at  about $13.00 a roll, but in fact it is imitation crab. I asked the server if it was imitation, he lifted the roll, looked at me and said "yes it is". A bold face lie. I asked to see the menu to make sure it was advertised as "real crab" and indeed it was. I again told the waitress. She told me again that it was real. I had to dig through the roll to prove that I knew it was fake. How shameful on their part. To just lie to costumers. I'll never come back. I don't appreciate dishonesty.
author: Monica R.

description:
Agedashi tofu = tender and plenty to share for an appetizer. $5.95

Bento box for lunch = choice of two items (8 options and no duplicates) with miso soup, salad, rice and California roll. Salad had wilting lettuce, so no bueno. I chose saba shioyaki and sashimi (2-tuna and 2-salmon). The food was decent for the price of $9.99

My friend had the sashimi entree, which came with miso soup, salad and rice. 12 cuts of sashimi, chef's choice. It was tuna, super white tuna and yellowtail. It was decent. $20.95

Service = friendly. English isn't their first language, so don't overcomplicate the order. Yes, Korean run, so if you know Korean maybe that'll help. 

Seating = plenty.  

Prices = reasonable to moderate. Total bill came out to $40.07. They bring you yogurt drinks at the end of the meal, too.

It was very hot in here, and finally, they opened the door and let in some cool SF breeze near the end of our meal.
author: Fannie S.

description:
I really like this place! My bf and I love this spot. Their sushi seems always fresh they have lots of options and their are all super nice and friendly.
We usually go there early and it is always open and there is always a spot for us. I love they always give us something on the house.
author: Bruna R.

description: Only negative part about this place is hey have no music and it's awkwardly quiet. This food was honestly REALLY good and the fish was super fresh. I would definitely return!!
author: Shannon M.

description: We got the veggie tempura, unagi don, large hot sake (big enough for two!), and a chicken katsu/beef teriyaki bento box. Food was delicious, service was excellent (the tempura took awhile to come out and they accidentally gave us pot stickers at first instead, but then gave us the potstickers on the house). They gave us complimentary salmon tempura and a yogurt dessert drink, which was a nice surprise! We had to wait for ~15 min as every table was full when we got there, but it gave us time to peruse the menu.
author: Allie M.

description: Fantastic chicken katsu. I'd never had it before. Apparently the sauce is some kind of family recipe. The place feels family owned and operated. The waitress could easily have also been one of the owners. She obviously took great pride in the restaurant.
author: Tim B.

description:
We got the boxes. One of my friends got the combo with rolls and salmon teriyaki and she said it was ok-ish, it was not hot. My other friend took beef teriyaki and tempura and he said it was actually good. I got the chicken teriyaki - which was really bad... The chicken was liked grilled microwaved chicken, it was dull and not warm. And my combo had also the sashimi, it was good but the cuts were really thick. 

They gave us some appetizer for free, like small fish balls. It was ok.
author: Mari Carmen M.

description: Pretty disappointing teriyaki, with gloppy sauce that had little flavor, decent miso that probably came from a packet, and a little salad. Everything kind of felt like it came from a box in the kitchen. Service was nice enough but indifferent, but it's not somewhere I'd go back to.
author: Jake V.

description:
Wow. Super impressed with our whole dining experience here from the fresh-as-can-be sushi to the incredible cozy spot and impeccable, fast service. We dined there around 6:30 on a Thursday night and we got a table immediately upon walk in.

They have a 5+ page menu that has pictures of ALL of their special rolls. It definitely helps with getting an idea of what your roll is going to look like. Very cool idea. They offer appetizers on the house, which is pretty awesome. Small sake selection but they're all GOOD ones. Two large beers, two sake bottles, a bunch of apps, 2 special rolls and some sashimi and our bill was $100 exactly. You can NOT beat that here in SF for two people 

We'll definitely be going back. There are SO many more rolls for us to try :)
author: Corri C.

description:
Yikes! The lady spit rice out of her mouth and forgot our sushi order.  I had a lunch bento box, with chicken and salmon roomate ordered sushi which never came. Dismal, dry pathetic pieces of meat which hardly tasted of weak teryaki sauce. We didn't remind her she had forgotten our sushi order.  Its hard to accept this review with the pictures looking delicious however I had a very poor experience. 

Dinner may be different but I will not bother.  Super dissatisfied as the name lead me to believe I was in the world of great teryaki.
author: Kai W.

description: 15% mandatory tip demanded upon our entrance. but varied from customer to customer. waitresses did not tend through out our meal besides when we placed our order and requested the check. not so sure how i feel about that. food was good and decently priced but customer service did not feel friendly.
author: Eirené G.

description:
I freaking LOVE this sushi restaurant. It's unfortunate they don't offer delivery. Best rolls ever ;-) but the 3 stars is because most of the time it's too damn hot inside! it's more like Sushi Sauna. Maybe they had problems with the hitter, who knows... but when I go there for dinner  I try to seat near the front door. ...And I have to be honest, after all that's why reviews are for.
Service has been ok for most of the time, they are friendly and very good hosts, but there are some days that service is really poor bc they have some inexperienced wait staff and that really brings the whole experience down. My POV, they could have worked out that issue long time ago, but you know what? I love their food and it's great to go there, specially when service is fast and organized. :-)
author: Coté M.

description:
Great food, terrible service. They lost our order twice, and we were there for 2 hours -- the first hour we got nothing. We asked for water (it never came), asked for a refill on tea (never came), they only brought us one miso soup when we both ordered meals that came with it... the list goes on. They were really disorganized. They apologized after more than an hour without food and offered us ice cream "on the house" -- uhhh, we've been here before, we know you already get ice cream as part of the meal? 

We'll only come back if the place is empty, because they aren't great at managing lots of tables -- we weren't the only ones with forgotten food and lost orders.
author: Laura J.

description:
This little teriyaki and sushi spot in the outer avenues of the Richmond is a real delight. Some nice decor and an attentive staff create a relaxing environment. 

The sushi moderately priced and here was a nice variety and the three dishes I have tried all tasted quite nice. No disappointments there and I also had complimentary fish balls for my way between the tasty miso soup and the sushi. 

I'll definitely come again to check out their ebisu chef special.
author: Jack S.

description: Usually not crowded unless it's Friday night. I came here a few times with my friends and they always give the guests free fried fish balls or shrimps before your food is here. Recommend: orange blossom roll (if you're salmon lover), ikura nigiri & new spider roll~
author: Maddy L.

description:
Good food. Had the chicken katsu it came out fresh and hot and cooked perfectly. The salad, soup and edemame were good. 

Service was amazing from start to finish!

Thanks!
author: Sol P.

description:
3.5 stars
First time coming here last week. Ordered  the bay scallop roll and the orange blossom roll. Can you say yum? The orange blossom roll was salmon goodness inside and out, it was fresh, almost seemed buttery and melted in your mouth. The bay scallop was baked to perfection with a perfect sauce and the scallops that were not rubbery.

We were also given free shrimp skewers and ice cream! :) that's always a plus. Waitresses were nice and kept coming over to refill water and to see If we needed anything else.
author: Stella J.

description:
Went to this place because Yu-Zen was closed for presidents day and I was pleasantly surprised. Although not super fancy it delivered tasty teriyaki house food better than expected for a reasonable price. Tako & cucumber salad was good, generous for the $8.5

Bentos are served on an antique looking wooden box with the tray set inside. Nice presentation :)

Very good service on my visit, unlike some of the reviews I see here. Strange, I wonder if there was a bad server in the past? The server we had was really on point.
 
Overall I'm impressed and will definitely consider this spot when I'm in the mood for a bento.
author: Cortland T.

description:
We go to this place often as this is near our home and it's on the way to the movie theater.  I liked the place as the staff isn't so attentive, they just serve ordered food without much there to say. They do not bother you while you eat.
Today we stopped by this food place again.  Again, the waitress paid zero attention to the attendees of the restaurant, and just simply brought the ordered food.  Then.... she rang us for $92.00 instead of $32.00!  Good thing we checked the receipt! Hannah, after we told her about this, gave us the voided check and rang the correct amount.
I will have to check my bank account to see the charges later.  
That doesn't leave good impressions!
author: Anna T.

description: Ordered several sushi rolls for takeout, and each one that was supposed to have avocado had carrot. No warning or explanation as to why. So a raw crunch instead of creamy avocado. Not sure i'll go back.
author: v. C.

description:
I don't usually eat sushi, but my best friend took me here for lunch and I don't regret it one bit.

I ordered the croquette.. which was a fail. It tasted like chinese hash browns, lawlz. Best ordered the Bay Bridge and the Hamachi roll. Both of which are freaking delish. Definitely recommended.

It seems like they give you a lot of complementary stuff while they're at it too. Best and I got a complementary shrimp skewers dish. :)
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Outer Richmond is great for many reasons.  One particular reason is that you can easily find restaurants to walk into on a Friday or Saturday night and instantly get seated.  Balboa Teriyaki is one of them.  A trip out to the end of Balboa can be a sweet date excursion.  The fog, the Balboa Theater, plenty of cafes and restaurants, off the beaten path and quiet.  

But if you are in the mood for sushi out there, might as well head to Yu Zen further down the street.  Balboa Teriyaki was alright but nothing special.  The best part of the dining experience was how quiet it was inside, and that the 2 of us got a big booth like table instead of being squeezed into the sushi bar practically on top of someone else.  

 Sashimi Salad was ok.  Rolls seemed to be heavy on the rice and light on the fish.  The food was very average.
author: Chelsey G.

description: Drove by this neighborhood so many years & just realized that they serve good food & the place is clean. Good for hangout.
author: Wendy W.

description:
Another great Japanese restaurant in SF. Once again we invaded the 3500 block on Balboa and decided to try this place. I can describe this place in three words
MMM mmm MMM !!! 
The service was EXCELLENT - very nice, no hovering 
We ordered a lot and also got a couple of items on the house.
First up was The Little Bomb which is the fried Jalapeno with cream cheese and salmon or tuna. It looked beautiful and was just tasty
I ordered the Bento Box which had beef teriyaki and deep fried pork slices. It was delicious ! I liked the beef the best, it was just so juicy and flavorful. The salad and rice were all fine. 
We ordered the California roll with real crab. Im not really a sushi eater - the seaweed and fish was strong. 
The misses ordered the Tempura which was all sorts of deep fried veggies and we both enjoyed it ! I loved my meal and hers 
Deep fried shrimp on a stick - on the house and was really crispy and tasty. Even the head of the shrimp was edible. 
Balboa fish ball - also on the house and was yummy
We even got soybeans on the house and they are not only good to eat but fun to play with trying to get them out of the pod.. fly little bean fly !! 
The meals came with Miso soup which was good. 

It was pricey (60.00) but when you're hungry and order a lot thats what happens. But I left quite full and couldnt order the desert. 

I know my review differs than a few but you know what - go to this, try it out and see how you feel. I left with a smile and full belly eating what I thought was really good Japanese food. And yes there is that Japanese ambiance to go along with it.. 

Go now ! Look for the Godzilla roll Kaiju fans :)
author: David S.

description:
This Japanese restaurant opens on Monday which is better for a lot of people to enjoy delicious Japanese food on Monday lunch & dinner.

I enjoyed the quiet calm Monday dinner yesterday.  The Owner couple is very genuine good hearted people that very hard to find in cold city like San Francisco nowadays.  Every time we go there gives us something pleasant surprise service that on the house.  Plus they are so tasty that feel the warm hospitality through the bone.  It's good that it's the only one that certain area out of lots of coffee shops router on Monday.
The menu is spectacular that customers can enjoy every bite. I would highly recommend any sushi rolls like Orange blossom.  Trust me!  They are SO GOOD!!   It's very delicious and healthy for that price.
Go there and it's worth the bucks we spend.
author: Piano B.

description:
I tried the Bento box dinner it was one of the best Bento box meals Ive had in a long time, they also added a few appetizers before my meal was ready, like a small dish of soy beans called edamame, a fried fish ball , a salad and bowl of Miso soup

the Teriyaki beef was very tender and delicious, very good quality

I also enjoyed the Tempura, it was cooked perfectly, I was very satisfied with the great food and the excellent service, this is a real Japanese restaurant, they are very professional, I highly recommend this place!
author: Mr Bolo B.

description:
Terrible, they kept screwing up our order in nearly catastrophic ways. Our appetizer didn't come out until after our entree, and when it did it wasn't the vegetarian appetizer we ordered. Instead it was a shrimp version of what we ordered and my vegetarian friend almost ate one (I should have let her). The rolls are wimpy, all rice and little flavor. Also, our table didn't have soy sauce,napkins or even water. 
 Lame
author: Eric B.

description: This is my favorite place to grab dinner before or lunch after catching a movie at the Balboa Theatre. I'm a bit obsessed with the warm and very delicious Bay Scallop Roll, while my kids love the Fish Balls, Croquettes, and Avocado Roll. I honestly can't speak to any other dishes here, though the service is always super friendly and they always bring us a yummy complimentary app or two.
author: Kim S.

description:
My lady and I notice this spot often while perusing the other outerwear-Richmond delights such as #ShanghaiDumpling. So, we gave it a try...

We had chicken teriyaki lunch with includes miso soup and a salad. Miso soup yummy. Chicken, kinda boring. Just a cooked breast with some teriyaki sauce on top. Salad...meh. 

Double hamachi roll...too much spicy mayonnaise inside. Fish was good. But, didn't love the other components. 

My girl had some Uni and she said it was delicious. 

We also had the cucumber salad topped with octopus. And, that was decent. 

For 41 dollars plus tip I can't really see myself returning here. Shoulda gone to #Ebisu instead...would have been ten dollars more and super delicious!
author: Dusty B.

description: I have to say I was pleasantly surprised by this place. I came here for the sushi and it was excellent! It appears that they have more than teriyaki on their menu. I highly recommend the double hamachi roll. That is...if you like your hamachi doubled....
author: Paul G.

description: Everything was fantastic! We avoided the sushi rolls, only because of the prices. Could be a couple dollars cheaper, we would've been in. We each got a lunch special. I got the bento box, $10. Worth every penny. No complaints, other than a little language barrier causing less dialogue. But everything was great! I recommend it!!
author: Brittany G.

description:
Service was good. Very attentive n courteous. 
Sushi was fresh n good, but tonkatsu donburi needs more eggs on it as it is in Japan.  Did not like this dish at all. 
Beef udon was tasty.
author: Kelly K.

description:
Right from the moment we stepped into the restaurant we felt so welcomed and cared for. The attentive service never missed a beat right the way through our meal and proved to be a highlight of the experience. Now on to the food. The edamame was seasoned and cooked perfectly to provide a great starter to the evening. All sushi was executed with a deft hand and were all delicate and perfectly sized. All in all a fantastic meal that would bring us back time and time again.
Food 10/10 service 9/10 decor 9/10
author: bluemoon p.

description: Came here on a whim on a Wednesday night around six. Got seated for two immediately. Service was friendly but spotty. Both of us got Bento Boxes (probably the best deal they have.) I had beef and she had chicken and we both got tempura. Nice variety in the tempura, though the shrimp were off, not sure what the taste was but it didn't seem like regular shrimp tempura. I know seafood can be varied but that combined with luke-warm meat and a bill of over $50 for two people, can't say I'm really impressed but it wasn't bad. On the plus side, it's open till ten!
author: Jason Z.

description:
YES!!!!! We found our sushi restaurant.. We use to live in Sacramento ca and we had our sushi restaurant that we go to all the time. But since we moved to sf we've looked n looked and now finally we found it.. It's balboa teriyaki. Their sushi roll is so good!! The fish Is fresh and there are real sweet lady's working there. 

We ordered the lambada, little bomb & a few more rolls but I forgot the name. But they were all so delicious. The best part if the price.  It a pretty fair price for the food.  I also enjoy the fact they they give us free appetizer. I thought that was very nice of them.  

Well this is thee sushi restaurant. And I'll be coming back more often.
author: Jenny C.

description:
Had the Bento box special with chicken katsu and sashimi. The katsu was all right and the sashimi tasted fresh enough. I enjoyed the miso soup, but it's hard to go wrong with that.

Service was good. The owner is very nice.
author: Ryuta O.

description:
Went here for early father's day dinner.  The four of us ordered Agedashi Tofu (very good), Soft Shell Crab (very good), four rolls, and Regular Sashimi Dinner (very fresh Sake, Maguro, White Tuna).  The restaurant comped us four grilled fresh water shrimp, fish ball appetizer, and edamame.

Love it when a restaurant comps items!
author: Scott L.

description:
This place is too pricey for what you get.  
Very small portions.  Don't come here hungry,  you'll come out still hungry.
author: ramon L.

description:
If i could, I would certainly give more than 5 stars.

I really wish I wrote this review sooner because I don't really remember what we ordered. A bunch of different special rolls. I do remember that it was really really good. They came out in a timely manner and looked nice on the plate too. 
The service was impeccable. 

Oh, I will so be back.
author: Wanda M.

description:
I never use the word hella, but theres always a first. This restaurant is HELLA far. From Russian Hill to 30th avenue was an eternal ride of $27 in a cab. In the cab ride, I was telling the cab guy a funny story of a date I had where the guy got belligerent and passed out on a sunday morning and I ran away. He is from Sudan, and started to ask me: "But why do ju wiman like jirks?" I told him, I don't know man, I don't know.. It seems to go backwards, doesn't it? He didn't charge me for the cab, gave me his card, and said I was funny.

My friend is getting married this year and decided to invite around 30 people here. We pretty much had the whole restaurant to ourselves. They told us a cute story of them coming here every week when they were dating. Now they live happily ever after in Brazil but craved Balboa Teriyaki during their stay here. 

The staff is nice and we each got a free $20 coupon. I never eat sushi on Sundays, but it was very fresh. Take my word for trying the hamachi, unagi, and the mochi - all awesome!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
We came, we ate great food, had amazing service, and we will be back. 

We ordered and enjoyed:
-lambada roll
-agedashi tofu
-chicken teriyaki
author: Licette M.

description:
I've come to Balboa Teriyaki since I was a kid.  The owners/management has changed over a couple times, but the present management is still doing a swell job. They do have really awesome rolls and a huge variety of em. I like that their sushi menu is like a picture book since I definitely like to see what I'm going to order. The sushi is good for being right up the street, but I wouldn't say it's the most authentic sushi/sashimi experience... if that's what you're looking for. The prices are average normal for gigantic sushi rolls like at other sushi spots ($11ish-$15ish). I like ALL of the rolls I've tried! 49ers, Dragon, and the baked scallop one especially.

Beef teriyaki is pretty good as well. Sukiyaki is too sweet for me.. I know, I know it's supposed to be a little sweet, but I guess I compare it to the homemade sukiyaki my Japanese grandmama makes. Most everything I've tried is pretty good, but my favorite things on the menu are the Sashimi and the Poke salads! The spicy sauce is soooo delicious with the fish and the mixed greens. I just wish they were bigger. The place is small and the service is ok when they aren't super busy, which they can get sometimes. Not ideal for big groups unless you call ahead to see if the tables are open. Usually get an on the house app and ice cream at the end.

Three stars only because it's not the most exceptional place, but it is solid. My family and I will continue to come here for sushi dinner close by.
author: Rachelle F.

description:
Balboa Teriyaki is a nice neighborhood gem that unfortunately is priced slightly too high. Honestly the sushi is fresh and tasty but your pay a few extra dollars then you would elsewhere for similar rolls. 

The service is great. Every time I have visited I have been comped a appetizer or two. 

Maybe a few drink specials and better sushi deals would drive in some more business.
author: Andrew M.

description:
This place is good if "I need sushi NOw!" It has sushi/sashimi but it seems like they are more about the fancy rolls like the Lion King Roll, Rainbow Roll, and the like. 

They gave us some sort of fish ball appetizer on the house. So nice of them and very delicious :)
author: Andy M.

description: Really friendly family ran restaurant! I came here with a friend right before they closed. I thought that we would be the last but even after we got seated a few more small groups of people came in. They were really nice to not reject people at that hour. It was about 9:30 when we got there and it was closing time. Rolls were great and the service was awesome. They also gave up fish balls on the house. It was literally made of fish. I think it was ground salmon fried into a ball. Price is also really fair.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Ye this place is great japan restaurant ive been before. Sometimes they r busy and service is slow but food is perfect. Specially i love rolls. Definitely i go back again and try the other rolls what I didnt try.
author: Taehwan K.

description:
We originally came to get soup dumplings in the area but the line was too long so we just walked down the street and spotted this place. There were only 4 other people in the restaurant on a Sunday evening. The interior was nicely decorated and it was quiet, which was a huge plus because I could actually hear my conversation. The staff were really friendly and I liked how they greeted us in Japanese when we entered.

We got complimentary fish balls on the house and they were delicious. I got the salmon teriyaki and tempura dinner combination and the lambada roll. The roll was gorgeous and looked like a work of art. It was really good and fresh and I would happily order it again. The salmon teriyaki on the other hand was not that great for the price. The teriyaki sauce was too sweet and sticky.

My friend ordered the oyakodon and while it looked nice, it was not what he was expecting. The oyakodon here had vegetables like broccoli and carrots in it which crowded the dish and ruined the flavor/texture.

I would come here again if I were in the neighborhood but probably not intentionally go out of my way for.
author: Bommy C.

description:
This is a cute neighborhood spot. The menu is standard Japanese restaurant fare with a mix of sushi, udon, bento box combos, and ala carte entrees.

I had the chicken katsu and the chicken teriyaki bento box and both entrees as well as the side dishes were good. The service was polite and friendly.

I'd like to come back to sample the interesting-looking sushi rolls.
author: Dani D.

description:
We dropped in here today on a whim, since we were in the neighborhood on other business. There were daily specials on some of the rolls, so we tried out two of them. Both delicious! I think we had the Hawaiian and Red Dragon. Both were spicy; in hindsight I wish we'd ordered a not-spicy one for contrast. But they were both very good.

My son has discovered a love for teriyaki beef, so we ordered the teriyaki beef meal for him. The beef was thinly sliced, and was very tender and well flavored. We also had a saba meal, and the fish was large and well cooked and very flavorful.

The best part was the attentive service and friendly atmosphere. It was a nice lunch out for our family. When we're back in the neighborhood again, we'll definitely come again!
author: Jason W.

description: LOVE this neighborhood gem in the Outer Richmond. Family owned and really friendly staff. Our family comes here quite often with 3 kids 5 and under - they are always accommodating and attentive. All of the rolls we've tried & entree meals have been delicious and we also love their little appetizer perks and the yakult dessert!
author: Tasha M.

description: With me and my Father's already generous order of 2 rolls and bentos. We got a nice on-the-house fried shrimp roll (of 2 pieces). We were the only ones in the restaurant, so the service was excellent :). I look forward to coming back.
author: Christian M.

description:
Korean owned.  Great, attentive service.  Small inside.  Cute decor.  

I went on a Wednesday afternoon around lunchtime.  Place is small.  About half full when I went (three booths filled & one table + me, eating alone, sigh).

I had a headache and I didn't really feel like eating but this place seemed so inviting and where I could just relax for a few minutes.

Everything I ordered came out in about 5 mins.  They kept offering me tasty sides *on the house*.  Salad was definitely mayonaissey but unexpectedly good.  Loved the bento box presentation.

Even though I had to run (I miscalculated how much time I had for lunch) the staff was super sweet and packed up my lunch and even offered me green tea ice cream! 

Will definitely come again.  Thanks (:
author: Kimiko Q.

description:
This place is great, not only do they give out free items on the house to satisfy your palate, the customer service is phenomenal. It's no secret that the owners are Korean however the quality of food is GREAT. 

NOTABLE ROLLS: 
49er Roll 
The Grinch 
The Sexy Roll 
Dragon Roll 

The Bento boxes are a great deal as well. If I could give this place 6 stars I would because between the good service, great prices and excellent quality of food I am always pleased with my experience at Balboa Teriyaki would definitely recommend this place to anyone who likes a solid eating experience at a good price.
author: Jay Y.

description: This place is absolutely terrible. The food and service are definitely poor. We ordered 4 rolls and 1 tempura and it took 1 hour. The tempura came out and completely soaked the placemat in grease. Disgusting! Definitely would not come here ever again!
author: Katelyn L.

description: I love their sushi especially the deep fried sushi. It's fresh and flavorful.  The service I'd great and yes I'd eat there again!
author: Valerie R.

description:
We used to patronize this restaurant until we had to cut back for different reasons.  However, we found their prices to be a little bit higher than at other restaurants especially for the quality.  And we had to always pay for metered parking.The portions are extremely small and honestly the saba doesn't look like it was properly grilled.  The teriyaki sauce tastes extremely sweet and congeals which makes the food unappetizing; the teriyaki chicken doesn't look like fresh chicken as it's flattened and pale. We randomly tried different rolls, and, to us, they did not taste good especially for the high prices they charge for them. They give some complimentary items like fish balls and skewered prawns as well as a yogurt drink (when the bill comes), but truly they don't make up for the mediocre quality of food. Service, however, is usually quite good though.

Thanks for the 'funny' vote, you ignorant person.  Nothing about my review is even remotely funny in the true sense; if you're offended by the low rating and my honest comments you're the one with a problem.
author: Luisa T.

description:
My current favorite spot to go for sushi!

Service: I love them! All the staff greet you both when you come and leave. All the waiters I've dealt are really friendly and hard working. Only when it's busy they may forget about you but will happily accommodate when you are able to wave them down.

Food: I love how their rolls are really unique with LOTS of ingredients. I try a new one every time and it's always been really good. I also love their free fried shrimp appetizers and free green tea ice cream :)

Price: A little pricey for a neighborhood type place but I think it's worth it :)

Come back: Yes! Whenever I'm craving sushi : )
author: Van C.

description:
Headed to the outer Richmond fog to lunch on Shanghai dumplings.  Was sad to find both joints are closed on Tues. Sooo, walked around a couple blocks & decided to give this place a go.  

Glad we did.  Got the 2 item lunch box - $8.50 - which included 4 pieces of CA roll too.  PLUS all these freebies:  edamame, 1 skewered shrimp, 1 seafood dumpling & green tea ice cream!!  The food quality was much better than Ichiraku which also gives freebies.

The salmon teriyaki was ok & tonkatsu good (didn't look like a fried frozen patty like most other cheap Japanese joints).  The tempura was also much better than most - light batter & not greasy.

Our waitress was responsive & nice.  It's a small place.
author: Kim S.

description: The best Japanese in the Bay Area! Clean , fresh, tasty and the service is AMAZING! MUST GOOOOOOOOOOOOO!
author: Iasmini S.

description:
3..5

FOOD:
1.) $9.95 lunch bento special! Choice of two items, I chose teriyaki chicken & the tempura veggies, but sashimi was also an option! Meal comes with rice, salad, miso, & a little cali roll. Honestly tho, food is a lil like fast foody. Meat isn't tender... 
2.) 49er roll = topped w a thin slice of lemon adds a sharp zing to it
3.) Volcano roll = deep fried fusiony buuut not badd! 

SERVICE:
Nice, they gave a few things on the house bc the group I went were regulars. But generally they're kinda slow-paced.. Things on the menu are as if a regular Japanese restaurant but it's bc they're swarmed by the Wash Highschool lunch rush that they know they can jack up the prices.

AMOSPHERE:
Small cozy, few tables and few booth seating with some japanesey influences
author: Angela L.

description: I came here on a desperate attempt to just get something to eat but little did I know, the food there was going to be more than just filling (well, I'm "tiny" so Idk about you guys, one roll filled me up).  I ordered 3 special rolls.  The Lambada, Playboy, and Lion.  I give the Lambada a 100 stars.  I loved it.  The Playboy was just as good, but the Lion was okay; typical but a little bit on the sweeter end.  The waitress was really nice and funny.  The place was just a little bit shabby though... well compared to its food which was really good.  So yea, this place has good, fresh sushi for a good price so check it out!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
They changed owner for a quite a while already and the rolls are getting smaller and smaller, quality keeps going down, but the price keeps increasing.

My friend and I spent over $70 here, 

1st we weren't even remotely full, 2nd the food was way mediocre, 3rd the raw sushi does not taste fresh, service was okay.

I would not come back here for sushi, maybe a bento box.
author: Da Munchies A.

description: Great little sushi spot. I was looking for a bite to eat at 2:30pm and was delighted to see a sushi restaurant open. I was greeted by an adorable woman who gave me complimentary edemame and a fish ball. My meal consisted of fresh seaweed salad and fish. 5 star!
author: Jenny S.

description:
Excellent food and sushi !    It never gets packed but they do get busy.   Price is average for Sushi.  
Try the shrimp on a stick. and SASHIMI salad is the best.

Service is 5 stars !
author: Paul J.

description:
Been going since 1997 and NEVER been disappointed.

This time, went for lunch, their hours have changed, open at 2 pm!

We ordered:

Agedashi: deep fried tofu with sauce. Soft, silky, DELICIOUS!

New Spider Roll: it was good. but didnt taste like the crab was fresh fried though.

Caterpillar roll or something: delicious unagi on top.

House roll: this one was FREE!!! deep fried goodness

Golden  california roll: pretty and delicious, made with REAL crab!!! and they didnt skimp either!

It also came with soup and salad and edamame.
plus beer

altogether $48 with $8 tip already included

street parking
very helpful and friendly staff
I LOVE this place!!! never ever change!!!
author: Chriss L.

description: I used to come here all the time. Great sushi. They always give you a free shrimp or fish ball too. Always leave from here satisfied. When I lived in the area I went here all the time, always great service, very attentive. I'm sad I don't live around there anymore. $10 bento boxes that leave you full and satisfied, with whatever that dessert yogurt is that the end... man I miss you Balboa Teriyaki. I might have to make a trip out to you soon.
author: Wayne B.

description:
Love this small sushi place!
They have a great variety of rolls (4 pages menu ). Rolls are very creative and tasty.
Service is also excellent!
author: Viktoria K.

description:
Sadly, this place no longer lives up to its name.
It used to have good teriyaki sauce, so good that I always asked for extra to eat with my rice. 
*sniffle* You used to be one of my favorites while I was in high school. Where did you go wrong!?


Okay this is what really happened. Ownership changed, along with the menu and the cooking. The freaking prices went up and the food is not worth your money anymore.
It's only so-so now, not that great..
author: Susy C.

description:
5 stars again because of their great service and food, i've been coming here at least once a week since the first visit. :D 

FOOD is tasty and all the waiters/waitresses are so kind. i can tell they work really hard to please their patrons. :D

on a side note, i went inside to get some food to-go.  i got the bento dinner special with pork katsu & vegetable tempura.  it was a lot of food for the price of $15. i actually had left-overs and ate it the next day for lunch. whoo-hoo!

while i sat and waited at the front for a few minutes, they offered me some hot tea.  thereafter, one waitress offered me to sit at the table and gave me some edamame.
AND...
they also served me a yummy fried tempura fish ball.  i was quite sure what it was, but the presentation was so creative and looked appetizing.

after 10-15 minutes of waiting, i was already satisfied and left the restaurant happy. 

OF COURSE...
i went home and enjoyed every bite of the food. :D

THUMBS UP, Balboa Teriyaki!
author: Deborah C.

description:
We really enjoyed our lunch here last week. Lunch & a tip came to $25.00.

He had the beef teriyaki ans sashimi bento, and I had the tempura and chicken teriyaki bento. 

It started with miso (good) and edamame. They gave us complimentary spicy fish balls, which were quite tasty. The boxes had good sized portions. It came with a salad, and 3 good-sized pieces of California roll, and rice. There were plenty of vegetables in the tempura. The fish was fresh. We were so full we didn't have room for the complimentary green tea ice cream.

The service here was attentive, and they greeted us when we arrived and when we left. 

The prices have gone up and the portions are smaller than they were last year. But, it's still a good place to get lunch.
author: Monarch B.

description: I used to live in this neighborhood over a decade ago.  This restaurant wasn't there then.  We stopped in today after an afternoon at China Beach.  They gave us complimentary fish balls, edamame and some kind of "dessert drink" called BioCool - all freebies.  The saba and unagi nigiri I ordered were fresh and beautifully presented!  And I got the "New Crispy Roll" and that was delicious as well!  A total gem in the Outer Richmond, a great place to come for good sushi, good service and a totally no-stress San Francisco dining experience.
author: Kali D.

description:
We took a drive to the outer-Richmond to check out one of Matt's bookmarked location.

Man, this place is a nightmare for parking and jam-packed for dinner. After a 20 minute wait, the four of us were finally seated.

The two adults were very hungry and ordered a Combination Dinner package. Matt and son had Tuna Sashimi and Beef Teriyaki meal and wife and daughter ordered the Chicken Teriyaki and Shrimp Tempura. Both our dinner packages were $12.00 and had rice cold-salad and a bowl of Miso soup. Oh no, we weren't done. We also order a Dragon Roll. The popular Specialty sushi roll cost $8.50 for a pair, had shrimp-tempura and BBQ Eel rolled-up with rice and seaweed. 

Our meal was and prepared and cooked without any flaws and satisfied us. We enjoyed our meal with a soothing cup of Green tea. But Wife enjoyed her meal with a 24oz bottle of Sapporo. Matt is very happy to have found this Japanese restaurant in the outer-Richmond and might come here again.
author: Matt G.

description: The Mochi were not good. When I told the waiter I didn't like he brought me more out... Which I did not want. And he charged me anyways! Bad service.
author: Courtney D.

description:
This little sushi place out on Balboa is right next to Americana, a diner my friends and I tend to frequent when we're feeling cheap pho. I'm sure we made jokes about eating here numerous times ... until the other day, when we finally decided to stop by on a whim.

BT's main focus seems to be on sushi rolls based on the colorful picture menus taped to the front window, though the slightly more intensive menu you get inside reveals they also have (marginally more expensive) dinner items like donburi, bento boxes, and such. The pictures certainly look good, and as most of us (a group of six) were in the mood for sushi we wound up ordering based on how good the rolls looked.

Even though it was a Friday night around eight o'clock, the place wasn't too crowded. My friends - for some awful reason - opted to crowd into a small booth despite there being able table space for large groups like ours. Despite there not being many other customers though the service seemed a bit slow - slow to take our order, slow to provide ordered appetizers, and slow to bring our food. All in all we were actually at dinner for a good 3 hours or so, and it's NOT because we're slow eaters.

At the same time, the staff were nice enough to provide us with some freebies while apologizing for the wait. We got a round of edamame, a few cans of Coke and Sprite, and later some green tea ice cream free of charge. A nice gesture for sure.

The food itself was actually pretty good. Though I've had fresher sushi at other locations it was at a slightly higher cost, not that BT is particularly cheap or anything. The sashimi was tender and flavorful, the baked objects were cooked just right, and altogether the presentation was appealing, if lacking that bit of extra effort that some smaller sushi places excel at. Altogether a satisfying meal.

To me, Balboa Teriyaki is a lot like its neighbor Americana - it's the kind of place I wouldn't mind going every now and then, but you have to be in the mood to go, especially considering its location all the way out on Balboa (ignore that comment if you live in the neighborhood). If you're looking for a fancy, upscale sushi bar for a date or to impress friends, you might want to look elsewhere, but for casual dining it's a great little spot.
author: Will C.

description:
I've been eating here for a few years. This place got a new owner about a year ago - under old management, it was 5 stars. 

Recommended rolls:
A's roll (soft-shell crab, eel)
Bay Scallop roll (baked roll - covered in mayo)

You may want to consider take out from here, because your clothes will smell like tempura if you eat in the restaurant.
author: Eugene M.

description:
EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE.

Came in on a Sunday after being completely dissed at Yu Zen.  The staff here was very kind and welcoming.  Lots to choose from on the menu including special rolls for the week.  Service was quick.  Food was delicious.  And they even gave us a free roll.
author: Nicole C.

description: They are the only ones open at 3pm. All the other places open at 4.30 on. Decided to give it a try and we're pretty good. Service was pretty good-fast and attentive. Rolls and sashimi was good also. Will definitely go there again.
author: Igor O.

description: One star for a very friendly and quick service, another one for cleanliness and atmosphere. However, the food leaves a lot to be desired. Not sure if I went there on a bad day, but the rice was chewy and pretty much glued together, the fish was a little slimy (i.e. not super fresh) and the texture was off. Everything was sort of bland and tasted the same. The size of the pieces was pretty generous so if you're more into quantity and don't really mind the flavor, this place may be for you.The bill was  average for SF - two rolls (one special, one plain), two orders of (basic) nigiri and a small sake came up to ~ $37 plus tip That would have been more than acceptable for OK to good quality sushi, but I felt this place fell below the bar.
author: Zaneta O.

description: Good. Maybe a hair pricey on things. But overall, a good mainstay restaurant - and a decent backup to Miki's down the street if Miki's is too busy.
author: Art W.

description:
Green tea tempura ice cream with a thin drizzle of chocolate and cherry sauce. 

Where have you been all my life? *swoon*
author: G C.

description:
The new owners and staff are better than the old. The remodeling is great. The menus look polished. The service is a lot faster. Everyone is very kind. The food is tastier and more creative. Almost every time, I get something on the house. 

Keep up the good work, Balboa Teriyaki.
author: Paulina F.

description: Really good food. First time here and I am definitely coming back. I ate during lunch hours. Excellent service.
author: L V.

description:
I am still on my never-ending quest to find good Japanese food.

Bento box lunch was hit and miss. 

Saba - very good

Sashimi (tuna/salmon) - good

Miso soup - watery, tasteless mess with tofu cubes so tiny it was amusing but totally not worth adding.

California Roll - wins "most disgusting" award. Initially I blamed the foul taste on the imitation crab. Turns out it was the nori. I have never had nori that tasted like that - even stale nori tastes better. 

I think they need to taste what they make before they serve it and take a cooking class ASAP.

*and the free edamame/shrimp is nothing to get excited over. it's like being excited a Western style restaurant gave you free bread and it in no way makes up for the crappy food
author: Miharu Y.

description:
Quick note: obviously frozen food, bad service

Where to start... This place sucked. Don't go if you're extremely hungry because you're better off just starving to death. We only came because Miki down the street was too busy and the other place was close for the holidays. 

First off, we were seated and were sitting without service or even water for about 20 minutes. Then when confronted about us waiting and us being ready for so long, she simply said the kitchen was too busy and couldn't even come over to take our orders. Then when the food finally came, it wasn't even worth the wait. 

I'm giving it one star only because they made up by giving us a complimentary appetizer that tasted freshly fried. Other than that the chicken katsu we received was definitely fried from frozen and was not good. The two using we got had bitter zucchini, meaning that it had gone bad. The chicken in the udon was a weird from the freezer texture. Another dish we got was the unagi donburi and it was completely drenched in sauce. It was so hard to eat because the sauce was too strong. It made me feel like it was sauce with a little rice. Just horrible. 

And it's not worth the money. Our meal was $83 for the unsatisfactory food and only one good complimentary appetizer.
author: Jaysie Y.

description: Sushi is great here, best green tea ice cream too!! Been coming here for over 15 yrs never disappointed! B.T.S. Rolls are to DIE FOR!! DeeLish.. !
author: DeAnne A.

description:
I like this place. I have been coming here for years, even before the change of ownership. When this place was sold their menu changed, and they went through a rough patch. 

Now, they are on top of their game. Their food is solid and the employees are nice. 

I had to subtract a star because when we do go there (as opposed to getting take out) their service can be ify. They know me by name... but can't always remember to refill my cup of tea... not fabulous. 

Also, although there isn't much that can be done about this, sometimes you leave there smelling like you spent all day working as their fry cook. 

Overall, it's worth 4 stars... the rolls are yummy and most of the time their service is good! Fav rolls: godzilla, bay scallop, orange blossom, red dragon (just to name a few)
author: Irina S.

description:
Takes bad sushi to a new level. 

Burnt soft shell crab, brown and green inside. Ice cold sashimi, firm and chewy. Honestly astounded. 

Too embarrassed to even complain.
author: Joe P.

description:
100% Korean.
I like Korean Japanese better than Chinese Japanese.
Korean is very similar to Japanese.
Well, most Japanese culture came from Korean peninsula traditionally.
So, I am comfortable with Korean food.

I ordered a Bento "BOX" Dinner with Chicken-Katsu & Sashimi.
14 bucks.
The Sashimi was small edge part of fish.
The Chicken Katsu was wet saggy. wasn't crispy, wasn't juicy at all.
Really disappointed.
I wanted to like the place because the service was good.
I wasn't happy.
I had better!

Should I give another chance?
I am afraid to go back.
author: Nobu K.

description:
Hands down, my favorite sushi spot right now. I've been to a lot of sushi places and the greatest thing I love is the menu VARIETY! This place doesn't just offer the same generic rolls that every sushi place has. There's lots of combinations, it's almost hard to pick because I'm so tempted to try them all. Their sashimi is fresh and the size of the rolls/servings are perfect!

My personal favorite is the Titanic roll because I love tuna! There's one roll on the menu that even has mango, which I'ce put on my must-try list for the next time I come here.

The service is fantastic - the waitress today always checked up on us to refill water/tea and see how things were doing. On a day weekday (i went most recenty on a wednesday) when there weren't too many customers, my boyfriend and I were lucky to try their fish balls - on the house. Those were delicious!! Nice presentation too.

Prices are a little on the high end (slight splurge of $11-$15 roughly) but I think the whole eating experience is worth it.
author: Connie Y.

description:
Free stuff? Yes!
Easy to understand menu?! Yes!
Delish?! Yes!

Triple Win....
totally comin' back!

So, for a newbie-ish sushi lover...it's important to me to be able to go to a sushi place and feel comfortable learning about new things...trying new slimy deliciousness and not going broke doing it.
This place had adorable covered booths that pulled us in...and a menu that had loads of images and explanations. I learned about a lot of things I wondered about in the past. The waitress was really nice and helpful. When they gave us free tasters, I felt comfortable asking what they were and how to eat them. As my boyfriend says "Comfort is the new black"...
and this place made me feel so comfortable we stayed for nearly an hour!

Can't wait to keep learning and come back for more!

The sushi, btw, was also super tasty...the fish was soft, fresh and beautiful.
author: Katy A.

description:
FRIENDLY SERVICE! but more important.. FREE FOOD!
now that i got your attention... =)
yes, they give you a lot of on the house stuff.
i went with my boyfriend just for a snack.
we ordered a rainbow roll.
and while we're waiting for the roll they brought us some edamame :9 YUM!!!
and then they brought us 2 fried shrimp on a skewer. they were delicious! 
and THENN, yes they brought us more free food! they brought us some sort of salmon ball. not quite sure what it was, but it was hella good! and that's all that matters. and it was free :)

and after our free and delicious appetizers, our roll came :) it was pretty good :) not the best, but nothing to complain about. 

service: very friendly korean people who are very generous.
overall a great great environment and meal :)
our snack turned into more of like a meal.

at the end they give you this "membership card". not sure how it works. but basicallly everytime you eat there you get how much you spent typed on the card and some sort of discount from it the next time :)
author: Sachiko K.

description: I love the deep fried sushi roll! Its one of the best! The people there are very polite and i get very good service. OVER ALL GREAT!
author: Stephen H.

description:
Before reading this review, please ask yourself this question:  Is a sushi restaurant a real sushi restaurant if there is no sushi bar?  

Do not go here under any circumstances.

I should have canceled my order and left when my friend who I used to eat here with told me over the phone that I should leave immediately.  But no, the nice Charley said I must stay and see for myself.  He also told me  to avoid anything terriyaki at all cost.  great.  it just so turned out that I ordered a dinner bento with tempura and chicken terriyaki.  mind you, it came with weird fish balls that I ate one of and spit it out back onto my box right away.

we ordered some "fish":

yellowtail
salmon
albacore

so gross.  you would think that if the "itamae" is serving "fish" that is not so fresh, he might try to disguise that fact with smaller portions of fish and a little more wasabi than usual.  Not the case here.  In fact, each piece of "fish" was larger than my tongue and I have a big fucking tongue.  they also did not taste like what they were supposed to taste like, i.e. the "fish" must have been thawed (there is no fresh fish here) for at LEAST 8 days.  

the service was fine.  they asked if everything was okay like 5 times, which leads me to believe they either:

A) knew we hated the shit out of their food
or
B) knew their food would be passed up by a black lab (they'll eat just about anything)

I overtipped way too much because I felt really bad about how bad their food was.

oh, as soon as we walked in, my lady friend asked me if I thought the tables had just been finished.  yes.  they had been.  i have no nose hair left and i think the first three layers of my skin  is stuck to the top of the table.  

overall, and I say this with the utmost repsect to the folks who are trying to make it in the restaurant industry, close this place and do something good in this section of balboa and do what the smart korean restauraunt owners do and open a korean restaurant.  serve up some kalbi, some kimchee, sell some hite, whatever,  just stop making the mess that is masquerading as food at this restaurant.
author: Charley B.

description:
Service good. Free items good. Rest of food spectacularly mediocre. Greasiest tempura I've ever had (shrimp tasted like it had been marinated in Crisco).

If you find yourself here, get the ton katsu and skewered shrimp.
author: Mike G.

description: Came here and got a few rolls as I was craving Japanese food. Its closeby my house. It seemed expensive for what I was getting. The food was good not great. There are other places in the area that are better.
author: Annie P.

description:
LOVE this place. 

- FREE FOOD! We got free fried shrimp, edamame, and green tea ice cream. YUM!
- The sushi is yumtastic! I may not be a sushi expert, but the fish always tastes fresh
- Staff is friendly and kind 

How can you say no!?
author: Marisa K.

description: not too shabby! service was great and food was delicious! love the fact that they offer specials on the black board! $10 on some of their special rolls and maximum per table is 3.
author: Ann T.

description:
I'm majorly bummed. My husband and I used to go here all the time as it was close, inexpensive, filling, cozy, and lots of veggie options ie agedashi tofu, assorted rolls and vegetable gyoza. Went in recently and it just wasn't the same. From reading here I guess they've changed owners and it totally makes sense, soft lighting has been replaced by too bright lights, a hideous and huge sign out front, and the cute little dishes they used to use replaced by standard white china you'd find at IKEA... basically all the things that used to give this place character are now gone. 

That would be bearable if the food hadn't gone down hill as well. As a vegetarian I don't want some weird eel sauce on top of my VEGETABLE ROLL. Duh. Especially if said sauce was not in the menu write-up. Blech. 

I'm so sad my awesome neighborhood place is now lame.
author: Ravenna P.

description: I enjoyed a fine ten dollar lunch today at Balboa Teriyaki. Delicious udon -- really excellent soup -- perfectly cooked noodles., accompanied by very good tempura , of particularly fresh and tasty veggies. I really enjoyed it and would come again in a snap. Follow your lunch with a walk along the beach. A fine time indeed.
author: David A.

description:
We walked out of Legion of Honor and looked for a place for lunch.  This place just popped out in front of us on Balboa.  It's a cozy little Japanese restaurant.  The food was okay.  The wait staff gave us complimentary soy bean and fried shrimp.  Bento lunch was a super good deal.  Pick two items from the menu + salad + 3 pcs of California roll + miso soup.  

Ton Kasu - Just okay.  We had something much better elsewhere.
Tempura - Good
Grilled Fish - Good
Avacado Roll - Okay

After lunch, we had complimentary green tea ice cream.  How nice!  The service is attentive.  One thing they may need to pay attention is ventilation.  We felt a bit warm inside.  I would suggest if there are many customers inside, they should leave the door open.
author: J L.

description:
Food: This is actually my favorite place so far for beef teriyaki, It wasn't over or under cooked. The teriyaki sauce wasn't overwhelming either. They were really nice and gave us complimentary fried shrimp on skewers, too bad I'm allergic to shellfish. But this seems to be a regular thing they do. They have a huge sushi selection too. They also gave us complimentary green tea ice cream making us really happy and fulfilled. 

Service: Really nice and attentive nothing bad to say. They also have frequent eater cards,

Atmosphere: Small and cozy, I wouldn't recommend coming in a group of 8 or more because you'll probably get split up to different tables.
author: Kimberly S.

description:
I raved about this place some time ago as one of our favorite neighborhood restaurants.  Do you know the feeling when you return to a place you love and everything seems so ... different?  There's a gaudy sign outside, the menus are filled with glossy photos, the sweet-voiced Japanese girl who always welcomed you has been replaced by a brassy waitress, the lighting is too bright and the classic music has turned into all-purpose world-pop?  My husband and I looked at each other, and our hearts sank.  Gone, our favorite little spot!  Under new management.  Still, we wanted to be fair and at least try the food.  

To make a long story short: if your main interest is in quantity, this is the place for you.  Big portions.  Lots of fish.  Poke salad is REALLY spicy. (As in: mouth-on-fire spicy.)  Rolls are huge and filled with stuff, mostly cream cheese.  No worry here that you will be leaving hungry.  These folks are generous.  They can't really cook, the ingredients are not first rate, and they are certainly not Japanese, but they want to make sure you leave here with a very full stomach.  This is not my idea of a good time, but for some people, this may seem like a deal, so go for it.  

We'll mourn our sweet, gentle, family-style Japanese place ... and go down to Clement Street and eat at at Oyaji!
author: Sarah P.

description:
I must admit, Balboa Teriyaki is seriously going down hill. The service here is some of the worst i've ever seen, no question. But what offsetts the extreme lack of service is the fact that the food really isn't that bad once it arrives to your table. But that's it, that's the only thing. 

Tips and Pointers:
-Wait staff and management are very rude and not friendly, but I suppose very rude and not friendly are the same thing. Oh well.
-Food is good, try the unagi dinner
-Prices are midrange
-Wait staff again, very rude and not very friendly.
-Do you (the reader) want a tip? You're better off going to Miki's or Yu-zen. 

[NOT APPROVED, NOT AT ALL]
author: Eric T.

description: I've been coming to this place since I was 10 years old and have seen it change management a few times, but its at its best right now.  The staff is a step ahead, the food comes quickly and the drinks are always refilled.  The best part is the occasional free appetizer they send our way and the rolls they have on special every week.  The selection of rolls is GREAT and there is something for everyone.  I always leave so satisfied and like I feel I got my moneys worth.
author: Leslie W.

description:
This is a neighborhood sushi place. Their sushi are not what I would call great, but it is not terrible either. Great service (5 stars). Most of the times, they give you in the house appetizers. I come here, when I am in the neighborhood and want a place to go that I will know that I will have great service and also craving sushi.
I really want to give them a 4 stars, but just can't. Despite their service, it is still a bit pricey for a neighborhood sushi restaurant and their food IS tasty but not the best that I have had.

As an aside (if not in the mood of raw fish), last time I came here, we ordered the bento box with the fish option (forgot the name of the fish). It was well cooked, and quite fresh too. Just be careful, tons of little fish bones.

Great for big group (around 12-16ppl) though.
author: Ali S.

description:
