Ok, so - this place isn't bad. In terms of my part of the Outer Richmond, I'd say it's actually better than some of the other sushi offerings. Portions are good size, and the price isn't awful. And - as anyone who has read my reviews knows I will eventually mention - the girls that work there are awfully damn cute! 

That being said - this place really isn't much more than average. As other Yelpers have mentioned, they do tend to overdo any of the sauces - especially the cream ones. I personally feel this doesn't do justice to the fish. 

I just went this past Sunday (3/22) and the fish seemed to be fresher and better than it usually is. I have a bit higher standard when it comes to fresh fish, so my last excursion here wasn't the best - but I gave it another shot, and this past time around was a lot better - but still fell short of the mark. 

The waitress we had DID give us a few "on the house" items, which was super cool, but didn't manage to really make the experience that much better. 

if you just want some quick sushi and don't want to mess with all the fuss, this is a good spot - but if you want an honest to goodness sushi experience - go to one of the umpteen million other better sushi joints all over town. This spot is more a "I'm feeling super lazy and not wanting to leave the neighborhood" kinda spot.
author: Marco M.

description:
So, I went to this place after discovering that the place I wanted to go to originally was closed. 

When I walked in, the place was empty at 11:30 am. So, I thought it was probably really early in the day for lunch. I ordered take out, but when I walked in and about to order, I found that the staff were pretty rude and care less about the customer. It almost like they were in a bad mood or something. 

Anyway, I ordered beef teriyaki and tempura, and others ordered almost similar things. The price is very competitive with other Japanese place around, but the taste?!  Meeehhh!! methinks not!! Didn't like what I ordered and so did other people. And, to make matter worst, after a while, we all had sort of stomachache! 

So, next time?! I don't think so!
author: Daisy S.

description: Ok, we walk in sit down get our menus, our first time here so picky us had to read through the WHOLE menu and figure out what we want. The lady comes over, what would you like to order?uhhh.. don't know yet. She comes back 1 minute later..uhh still don't know sorry. 1 minute later...UHHH STILL Don't know. 1 minute later, uhhh still don't know. You get the drift? She sure didn't!! Sheesh! Then she sends over some younger waitress, DUDE! We are not ready! Just because you send someone else over doesn't mean we will order faster. Finally I told them we will let YOU know.Ok we are finally ready, uhh now NO ONE to help us! WTF! Ok got the food, I have to say it was pretty good so I guess I will need to come back. We got sushi rolls, fresh and filling. Oh but it was kinda pricey.
author: Karen T.

description:
I went here for a quick bite to eat. Sake and beer were good out of the bottle. Can't mess up stuff thats already bottled for you right? I just ordered some assorted tempura and it came with some free miso soup which is total score. The prices here are pretty reasonable, in line with a typical lunch for a chinese place. Definitely coming back if i'm in the area. 

P.S don't be stupid and say things like idatakemase or kom ba wa, lots of the staff are actually korean.
author: chris c.

description:
My girlfriend showed me this place and I would definitely recommend it to others.

I had the Lunch special (Ton Katsu) and she had a Bento box with salmon and saba. We also ordered a Dynamite roll on the side.

Everything was great tasting and not to mention affordable! When it comes to restaurants, I'm always critical of places that do not have the right kind of quality for the price they are asking for. 

To me, Balboa Teriyaki is right on the money! Great quality combined with a great price.
author: B L.

description: Nice low-key japanese restaurant in the Richmond district, SF. My husband and I are regular patrons here. We like that they are very nice and and food is always good. It has the mom and pop's kind of feel to it. Again, very low key restaurant. The food is not that expensive neither. Their sushi rolls will not disappoint you and you have to always have the green tea ice cream at the end of your meal. It is the perfect ending to a nice dinner.
author: J C.

description:
Great place for Extra Spicy Tuna Roll! score!
Great Staff, always very friendly---family owned, I think.
Generous sushi
Sometimes Easy Parking

On occasionally peak hours, tables may be full and customers may be loud. Last time, I came here with my roommate. We got seated right away, they gave us shrimp, soup, edamane on the house!! another plus is complimentary green tea ice cream. I highly recommend getting the Magic Dragon, but its usually a chef's special, however, if you're a spicy person like me, get their spicy tuna roll and ask for EXTRA Spicy. They know how to make it good unlike Nagano (on geary), they claim its spicy but its not. 

Con's
Since the place is pretty tidy, you can hear other customers' conversation. Also they have a large table for a party of 8 or 10, so beware, if your table is next to that---definitely will not be pleasant.
author: Adam C.

description:
The people who run this place are very friendly, customer-service oriented people. Just that alone makes me come back again and again. The last two times i have eaten there (after not being there for a while) we received a lot of things on the house. I think they gave us two appetizers, edamame, and ice cream for the dessert. And it was just the two of us. That's a really nice touch! 

I'm a big fan of sushi platters and usually when i order it at most places, the chef picks your sushi. So often times i end up getting the stuff that i don't like (i.e. i don't like the dead dry shrimp sushi - tastes just blah to me, or the egg one, which i can eat sometimes, but still not a real fan of it). However, to my surprise when i asked them what's included in the chef's choice and when i shared that i don't like shrimp and egg, guess what the waiter told me?? He said, no problem at all, we'll replace them with something else! What?? That is awesome, i love you for that!! And guess what, when my sushi platter came, it had two salmon and two tuna - my most favorite!! 

They definitely value their customers here and know how to please them! Given that i only live two blocks from here, i will certainly go back many more times!
author: Suzanna G.

description:
This place has gone downhill, we have dined here about three times in the last 18 months.  The food taste different, staff is nice, service is extremely slow.

The chicken kariaga is mainly batter w/no taste.  The bento meals are a fair deal (taste should be everything) - better off going to a mall food court for teriyaki.

We are moving on...
author: Rich W.

description: I eat here every week- Friday night sushi+bubble bath ritual. The other night I had my sister in from out of town and it was my students big winter show, we also celebrated my birthday, so it was a very special night, I went there with 6 of us and we were treated like kings, it was awesome. Totally un-asked by us, they brought us tons of free extras and a fried icecream ball with a candle for me, they sang to me, they just purely guessed it was my birthday. They also were gracious with how, ehem, 'gregarious' my friend got, so they are saints in my book.
author: Susanne A.

description:
Newest Update: 4/20/08
Ok, I'm going to leave both original reviews because they really do stand.  I am going to update the stars though, from 2 to 3.5 (not enough to make the graphic say 4).

Now that the waitress recognizes us, we get really great service.  We go at off times, know the menu a bit better, and we just roll with it.  I even like when we wait a bit because the atmosphere is really relaxing.  

I now always start by asking for sake and gyoza, right off the bat.  We then order a dinner bento box, an extra rice and miso, and two rolls.  That feeds both of us and we're stuffed and satisfied!  And, though the place is relatively inexpensive already, this makes for a really cheap dinner out.  One nice touch:  The bento box comes with a salad (he eats that) and the waitress brings me a little cucumber "salad."  It's sweet.

Favs on the menu:
Gyoza (meat)
Spider Roll 
Tempura!
Tonkatsu

My apologies for the run-on review.  This is a good place.  Take your time, be patient, and be willing to give it a few chances to see it's true value.  As a side note, I need to learn the waitress' name--I feel bad!

-------------------------------

People seem to have a love/hate relationship with this place.  Let me tell you, I'm on the "hate" end.  Honestly, I only intended to give this place one star but I'm winding up with two.  Here's my story:

We walk in there at 6:45 tonight (Friday).  Yes, it's a Friday night.  People go out, waits are long, etc.  But we walk on over there and there's even a table empty.  Cool.  Kind of a small place (about 12 tables?) and I figure we're ok.

We proceed to be ignored for about 10 minutes.  I finally asked for a menu (first mistake--I should have walked out).  She takes the order a few moments later.  Beer, sake, water, edamame, a few rolls, and a tempura dinner for him.  15 minutes later, beer and sake arrive with edamame.

He eventually gets a salad, a bit later some miso, I finally get a glass of water.  We hear a family nearby complaining that they've waited a good long time.  One waitress is slowly getting to people and there is no one else to be seen.  That is, except for the lady at the register taking phone orders and serving unseen people diligently.  Meanwhile, a room full of hungry, paying faces in front of her are growing mighty impatient.  

There's a couple that has been there much longer than we have that have even ceased talking to each other, they've been there so long.  She takes out her cell phone and starts playing a game (with the sound ON?!  How rude!!!).  But I understand her pain.

At 7:55, I glance at my own cell phone and the food is still nowhere to be seen.  Probably ten minutes later, some tempura arrives.  Followed semi-shortly by the rolls.  She forgot a bowl of rice (which never arrived in the end).  That couple with the cell phone girl?  They still hadn't been served.  My boy said we should ask about that rice.  I told him just to finish his meal because I just wanted the heck out of there!

You know, I hate to admit that the food was OK.  You know, it wasn't great, nothing special, but good.  And it's close and fairly cheap.  Common rolls range from $2.50 to $5.  Specialty around $8.  Entrees start at about $9.  Really, it can be a good deal.

I was not ok with waiting well over an hour for food.  Seriously, it wasn't that busy.  Get help if you need it people!  Customers are not going to put up with this!

Zero stars for service.  It was just terrible.  Very clean place though.  Booths are very private and you can relax there.  Food, decent.  Prices, great.  I give two stars because they might be decent for takeout.  It kind of goes against my morals to patronize a business who has such poor service.  But, like I said, they're two blocks away and cheap.  I might go for takeout.

All I can say for tonight is that they better be glad I had some sake to calm me down.  It could have gotten ugly.

UPDATE:  12/23/07
Last Friday, we went again.  Needed something cheap that we could walk to.  It was a very quiet night there, we were one of 3 tables.

Again, food was good.  The waitress is just pretty clueless.  We were halfway through our meal when we asked her where our two orders of miso were.  

Waitress: "You ordered them."
Us:  "Yes, may we have them?"
Waitress:  "You ordered them."
Us:  "Yes, we know.  Will you bring them?"
Waitress:  "Oh, you mean I didn't bring them?"
Us:  "No, you didn't bring them.  May we have our miso?"

I really shouldn't go back.  I probably will.  groan
author: Melissa Q.

description:
Ok, so this place isn't my mother's kitchen, nor is it Sushi Ran or any of the assorted over-priced but delectable sushi places in Marin and SF, but Balboa Teriyaki is better than decent!

For example, their tonkatsu bento lunch box is very yummy, and well-proportioned. I left feeling satisfied, but not so full that I was heading right into a food coma (a laCheesecake Factory or Yardhouse). Blah green tea, but I'm not exactly a conneuseur or anything. 

My friend Katja F. is pretty easily satisfied in a Japanese restaurant: "A bowl of white sticky rice is my idea of heaven." Well, if that's the case, they also provide a heaping portion of white sticky heaven here.
author: Christy M.

description:
My name is Liz and I'm addicted to sushi. My one-step program (it's helping my cravings, really it is...n't!) goes like this:

1) Haul ass down to Balboa Teriyaki at lunch and gorge self on avocado maki.

This place makes really good sushi. Like, REALLY good. It's LOADS better than Day Boat Sushi up the street (as well as cleaner) and is a whooooole lot less crowded during lunch because the door kinda blends into the background.

The woman at the register is slightly creepy, though. I'm usually the only one in there at lunch and sometimes I catch her looking at me with this intense look in her eyes. It's like she thinks I'm going to steal something. What am I gonna do, pour some soy sauce into my bag? This place gets one star off for that and the incredibly slow service. One day it took over twenty minutes for me to get my (very simple) order -- and I was the only customer there!

Actually, it gains that star back for being so cheap. The grand total was $12.69 -- for three days' lunch!

Is it weird to be in love with a sushi restaurant? Because I want to marry this place and have its sushi babies. And then I want to eat said babies. They would be good.
author: Liz A.

description: Teriyaki Bento box beef was of poor quality, salad dressing had mustard in it, which I didn't care for,  California roll had imitation crab, I had to pay extra for 2 shrimp Because they don't come in the Bento box tempura choice. Tempura was good, rice & Minsk soup was too, but that's hard to get wrong. @$9.95 what do I expect. This place is ehh.
author: Domina V.

description:
I craved sushi and happened to be on Balboa Street.  Not having any expectations but hoping for great food, we decided to check out Balboa Teriyaki.  They had abnormal plate sizes and nicely decorated sushi.  The sukiyaki was very good.   Plus, the waiter was very friendly.  

I would definitely go back.
author: Jeannine L.

description:
1) Too smoky - I'm airing my jackets now. They stink. 

2) Salmon Sashimi was not fresh which should be something basic in a Japanese restaurant. It broke apart when i put my chopsticks to it and it was mushy.

3) My unagi came sizzling AND SWIMMING in a hot plate of gooey teriyaki sauce. not acceptable. 

4) Service was slow.

5) My friend's grilled mackerel was OVERCOOKED.

Lesson to learn, if Miki is not open, DON'T stumble into Balboa Teriyaki, you will be very disappointed.
author: Marcia O.

description:
This place is a great deal when you get the bento box at dinner. I got sashimi and tempura in my bento box and there was a good amount of sashimi and tons of tempura. That also comes with free edamame, miso soup (with refills!), salad, and green tea for dessert all for $15. 

They also give fried shrimp on the house and each time i have gone there they always have given me some extra free food.

Once I got free a potsticker platter and another time I got fried sake balls. 

There is no sushi bar and that atmosphere is average but it is a really great spot. Service is fabulous and fish is very fresh. I highly recommend.
author: Rebecca B.

description:
beef was not up to standard...it was basic. tempura was good n decent.
salad dressing was not tasty, it had yellow mustard in it. the california roll had imitation crab meat.
no bueno!
author: Lexy H.

description:
I adore this restaurant. It's a little gem tucked away in the outer Richmond, and it has been a solid go-to for me the past three years I've lived in the city. Excellent service. Excellent food.

I highly recommend the sashimi salad, and eating the head off of the grilled shrimp appetizer.
author: Sean S.

description: Second time here and they gave us on the house edamame, fish balls and yakult (a sweet, milky kid's drink/dessert!). I think they do that all the time to most customers! Anyway, service was good but the lady was just a tad bit awkward.. She always filled our water up and cleared our table when needed though! She wasn't too invasive nor too friendly. We ordered two seaweed salads and 2 special sushi rolls. We got the samba roll and lion king.. It definitely hit the spot! We were unable to finish it so we just picked at it until only rice was left. The fish were fresh and the service was fast! No complaints from me here. I've tried the croquette here and it just isn't the same as the one my old manager made me! But still good nonetheless! The lighting was a little dim but that's just my personal preference. I hate eating in a dim environment! That is all!
author: Naz M.

description:
My favorite Japanese eatery. 
Their Menu is extensive, prices are ok and service is good.
Sushi is wonderful...ok, ok..everything is wonderful here. All the food is delicious.
I also really like the interior decorum. I love the bamboo walls that separate each booth...very private and relaxed atmosphere.
Loyal Customer.
author: Judith F.

description:
I took my friend here for the first time and warned her that although the food was great, service was often slow. We got here at 8pm on a Friday night and took the last open table. 

There were two servers and the place was busy. I was prepared to wait. What I wasn't prepared for was that the servers would ignore us and wait on two other parties that were seated well after we were. I tried to be patient, especially since I used to wait tables, but this was just rude. We didn't even get tea and meanwhile, they're bringing soup and taking orders from the other tables. I was proclaiming to my friend that I was gonna write a terrible review on yelp and I was never coming here again when, as if on cue, one of the servers came and asked if we were ready to order. Umm, heck yeah! I was still peeved at this point but when the sushi finally came, the freshness and oh so yumminess of the sushi made me forgive them.

I totally have a love-hate relationship with Balboa Teriyaki. The food is delicious and the menu is extensive, but the service is slow, even when the place is less than half full.

A note for the health conscious: Just because a menu item does not say deep-fried does not mean it isn't. We ordered this mango and asparagus roll topped with tobiko. Sounds healthy, right? Well, the asparagus was totally deep fried in tempura batter. Yes, it tasted great but damn it, I was purposely avoiding deep fried foods when we placed our order. If it was gonna be deep-fried, can't they mention it on the menu? They did that with other deep-fried items on the menu. So ask questions if you're trying to avoid something.
author: Wendy L.

description:
I love being a local somewhere. I like that the sweet waitress gives me a big smile and knows what I probably want to order the second I walk in the door. Yes, I'm predictable. Yes, she may be laughing at me. Still, she gives us extra miso soup for free. I like free.

The nigiri and sashimi are extremely cheap,  large portions and very fresh. The tempura udon is yummy as well. Between that and the fact that it's walking distance from our house, the boyfriend and I eat here almost every week.
author: andrea s.

description:
This is almost the closest restaurant to our house and we go there once a fortnight easily. If it was further away we'd stil get there monthly. any visiting relatives get taken there too, no matter what food they like. I'm a vegetarian but they're always willing to change meat items for vegetables (shrimp for asparagus tempora).

pretty much always go for the same thing: miso soup (incredible miso here), 1 new tempora roll, 1 mushroom roll, 1 (whatever the mango roll is called), 1 avacado, cucumber roll and 1 2 pieces inari.

The vegetable goyza is meatless apparentely but is so meatlike that we both spat it out. 

service is very good, waitresses friendly. the bill is always cheap.

highly recommended.
author: andrew p.

description: While I found the rolls to be a bit pricey, they were absolutely delicious.  I ordered to go and didn't get enough soy sauce with my order, but since I was headed home it was no biggie.  The staff is exceptionally nice and offered me water and tea while I waited.  The restaurant itself is a bit small, but I came here for lunch during a rainy weekday and the place was pretty full.  So far, this is my favorite sushi restaurant in my neighborhood.  Nothing fishy about this place......except the sushi of course.
author: Michael G.

description:
Went there a few nights ago with a group of 11, well 12 if you include baby inside person.  We had made a reservation and so our table was set.  The space inside is really small.  I think tthere were 4 or 5 booths along one side of the wall, and then our table for 11 along the other.  

Needless to say, they wanted us out of there as quick as possible. But since this was somewhat a college 2 year reunion they weren't going to get us out as fast as they wanted to.    

Their prices are great but what are great prices if their food was average for a San Francisco Japanese restaurant.   Their spicy tuna in their spicy tuna hand roll, wasn't spicy.    Tempura was okay, wasn't soggy so that's a plus.   Other people had the udon, or chicken teriyaki, which they said wasn't that bad.   

Parking is good if you arrive between 6 and 6:15.  After that, you will have to circle some blocks .  This is a 3.5 star place at best.     Would I come back again?  Umm... mebbe, but just to try out more of their rolls.
author: Herb C.

description: Must have switched owners. Grocery store quality sushi, high end sushi prices. We just spent 65$, not full, got 3 rolls, the smallest seaweed salad I've ever had (6$)? and 26$ order of chirashi which was not fresh and super small. Very unfortunate since they used to be decent, but we won't be going back.
author: Emily P.

description:
Had a very late lunch there today, so the place was empty which you dont want to see...but this place looked promising and was great!

I had the Unagi Don and Poke Roll. Portions are good, more importantly the fish taste Fresh and prepared so well!!

My husband had the chefs choice sashimi and the cuts were so good and generous.

They gave us a few items on the house: shrimp app and green tea ice cream.

Definately would go back!
author: santita h.

description: This place isn't bad since it's my first time. Sushi is decent, nothing that wows me. They're really polite and gave us free sushi and edamame, so that's a plus. I'll come back.
author: Mandy D.

description:
Balboa Teriyaki serves up my favorite teriyaki and sushi!!!

I've been coming here for a few years now and their beef and chicken teriyaki is my favorite.  Their cooking style is not consistent however, so they lose 1 star; sometimes their meat is too dry other times they are just perfect.  

My fiance and I always request our special order of sushi and they always make it for us just the way we like.  Like other posters have said, this place does take a while to get the food to you so do not come here and sit down if you have somewhere to be in 30 minutes.  

I usually try to only go during the lunch time since there is less of a wait and generally less people.  Lunch bentos run about $6-$8 depending on the meat.  They come with miso soup, rice, salad, and california rolls.  (thinking of this makes me drooool....)  
Other times that I've been there for dinner resulted in a long wait of over an hour.  They do tend to get real busy on the weekends too (parking is a nightmare...especially Sundays).  When it is cold, they tend to close the front door which traps in all of the smokey odor from the kitchen.  Other than those small things to point out, I still go back!!!  

Since this place is small, it is a great place for small groups up to 5-6 people, but once you exceed that, you might have to wait until small tables open up to accomadate a larger party.
author: judy l.

description:
Four of us went here on a Sunday afternoon about 5 pm since two in our group decided they wanted chicken teriyaki, and dammit, they wanted it NOW!

As we were the only diners, we were seated immediately and our waitress took the order with all speed.  We had a few questions about some of the ingredients/names and she happily answered.  We got edamame (always yum), seaweed salad (good), ahi sashimi and sukiyaki (good), chicken teriyaki (satiated the craving), spicy tuna rolls (yummmm, and with just the right amount of spice), a 49er's roll (I didn't try it, but it got good reviews from my compadres. The menu said it came with avocado slices on top but it was served with lemon slices), and philly rolls (best I've ever had).  For all that food, plus tea and salads and miso, our bill was $50.  Not at all bad for the quantity and quality.

Also note, by the time we were leaving, the place was packed!  Granted, it's small, but that's a good sign considering all the other choices on the street.
author: Laura B.

description:
When I first moved to the neighborhood, I went on a little tour of the restaurants here and this is one of the first I tried.  I didn't think it was going to be any good but the food was actually pretty tasty.  For their Teriyaki Beef, it seemed like it was real ribeye they used.  Had that certain smoky flavor.  

The prices may be a little higher than your normal cheaper Bento Box places but I think it's worth it since it is obviously better than some ot the other places that charge about 10-15% less.  I really thought Miki down the street would be superior to this place but so far, it hasn't been for me.
author: Mark W.

description:
Update:  I've been meaning to update this place since about 6 months ago when my friend ordered their teryaki chicken.  Bar none, this had to be one of the WORST things I've ever seen served in a restaurant.  I don't even think it was 100% chicken.  It looked and tasted like one of those frozen "chicken" products made from all kinds of junk that you might find in the corner of Walmart.  The gross texture was not helped by the fact that it did not seemed grilled, but microwave thawed first and then put on a grill just to give it some grill marks.  My friend and I could only stare at it open mouthed in amazement.  Neither of us had ever tasted anything so wierd and gross at a restaurant.  I don't care if their sushi is nice, there is NO EXCUSE for putting this kind of crap on the menu.  If you don't have the capability to put out an item at even the minimum quality, then just DON'T SERVE IT, regardless of restaurant name. The most positive thing I can say about the teriyaki is that it was probably not a health hazard.

I'm taking away 2 stars from my original review because the whole thing was just unbelievable. No, I'm not exaggerating.
author: Missy L.

description:
Quick Review: Go here for teriyaki, not for sushi

Long Review:

I have a long history with this place.  Back in the days when I was a sophomore (7 years ago?) in highschool at Washington (about 5 blocks away), this was one of the only places I ate at during lunch.  

These days I got here for their awesome teriyaki (chicken or beef, both are great)which is priced just right and tastes even better.  Their tekka maki (tuna roll) is quite good as well and has changed little since my highschool years.  Stay away from their sashimi however, a few times I got a frozen solid slab of fish.  Their california roll (yes, I know it's basic) made with real crab meat (by request) is quite good actually, so I normally order that along with my tekka.

Overall good food at cheap prices ($25 for two, what a deal!).
author: Serge S.

description:
**Please note: I only go here for weekday lunches.

Balboa Teriyaki is great! The interior is cute and clean and the lady who greets us is always super friendly.
The Lunch Bento Box specials are super cheap ($6.50 ish for a lot of food), actually everything on the menu is super cheap by SF standards. The sushi, while not being the best sushi I have ever had is definitely still very good. I love the Chicken Katsu, Calif roll, Tempura, pretty much everything. OK so the Miso is not the best but I can overlook that.
Oh and $2.95 for a glass of decent wine. We go here all the time and will of course be back, its my favorite lunch spot.
I guess maybe its a different story at night or on the weekends? Well for lunch this is the place to go. I highly recommend!!!
author: Catty C.

description: We come to Balboa Teriyaki all the time with our children. Quick service, decent food. Will continue coming.
author: S L.

description:
I've eaten here several times over the years, either before or after a movie at the Balboa Theater, whenever I was in the mood for Japanese and didn't want Chinese, Italian or Vietnamese food, which are all also available on the same block.  

The restaurant is very small and crowded when fully occupied.  The food is ok, not great or awful, but you can get better elsewhere if you're willing to drive there.  Just  ate here again a couple of months ago and had some grilled salmon which was fine.  Service is also ok, but they only have one server and you'll have to make an effort to get his  attention (it's always been a guy when I've been there) especially if they are busy.  They don't have enough room for a sushi bar and I've never had sushi here, because if I can't see it, I won't eat it.  However, they do serve some unusual Japanese dishes that are posted on signs on the walls and I've tried some in the past and it must of been ok because I don't recall it being bad but I also can't remember what I had, so it wasn't all that memorable.  I do recall however that some of the entree dishes seemed quite pricey.  So, it's advisable to pay attention to the price of what you're ordering,

I'd plan to eat there again whenever I'm in the area and am in the mood for Japanese food, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat there.
author: Martin C.

description:
The food here is good and price is decent.  I tried the beef sukiyaki for lunch($6.50), the thin slices of beef after soaking in the broth was overcooked but the broth was excellent.  I drank all the soup and almost wanted to eat the iron pot that holds the broth.  Yummy!
Also tried the chicken teriyaki and the chicken was cooked perfectly.  Service was awesome and the lady was super friendly with a great smile.  The only thing that can be better is the booth.  Although roomy but you gotta bend over to eat your food.  Sitting at the table might be a better choice next time when I visit.
author: Heidi F.

description:
The servers were nice, fast and attentive (which is why they get 2 stars), but the food was terrible and overpriced. 

The tempura was mediocre. 

The SF roll was soggy and watery. How does that happen? Honestly, Safeway's pre-made sushi is better.

The chicken teri don was rice + flavorless chicken + a gallon of way-too-sweet sauce. I felt like I was paying $12.50 for a microwave dinner. 

They gave us free shrimp but it didn't make up for the fact that we wasted $35 on the worst sit-down Japanese we've ever had.
author: Phatalie J.

description:
Sushi gets three or four stars, the teriyaki is too gloopy, but at least the fish is well cooked.

Miki (across from the Balboa Theater) is definitely the better restaurant.
author: Ravi C.

description: I like this place . I just came here with my friend yesterday . The chicken teriyaki was not bad . The California roll was okay . The tiger roll was really good !! It had a hint of spicy flavor to it which was nice . They gave us two shrimps on the house which tasted alright . They also gave us two deep fried salmon balls on the house which were pretty good =) . Good, friendly service ... very attentive staff . Will definitely be back !
author: Eileen L.

description:
There was nothing about Balboa Teriyaki that screamed above average when I was there. Decor was standard, menu didn't offer up much in the way of originality and the service was par for the course.

Then I loaded the first of five teriyaki chicken sushi pieces into my mouth and was overcome with sushi bliss.
author: Jason B.

description:
There's a part of me that believes Balboa Teriyaki would be much better served if they were not called Balboa Teriyaki. This is, of course, also the part of me that has yet to order anything with teriyaki in it from an establishment that is clearly, very proud, of their teriyaki. 

That being said if their teriyaki is anywhere near as good as their sushi, I'll bite soon. For the record the sushi at this place is quite amazing, the first time I went here it was on a whim, and when I asked how many pieces you get per roll and was informed that the number varied depending on price between five and eight I was a tad disappointed. But then the sushi was brought to my table and upon noticing that I couldn't actually fit the entirety of a single roll into my mouth in one bite, I was humbled. 

I have since been thrice and each experience has met with the same standards. Thanks, you supposed masters of the teriyaki, for the sushi, which, might I add, you are probably much better at making.
author: Stephen M.

description:
My favorite Japanese restaurant.  Maybe because it's so close to home, but regardless, it's Japanese owned and operated (a rarity these days), and what I can call "authentic".  The tempura is probably the best thing here, as the batter is nice and light.  The best part of this restaurant is the lunch specials.  Combo Bento Lunch boxes for the win!!


This place has since changed ownership and I cannot vouch for the 5 stars I gave earlier.  The quality, quantity, and overall satisfaction has taken a significant nose dive.
author: Alan N.

description: These people were GREAT! My boyfriend and I walked in after closing and they happily invited us in, served us and even gave us a few extras, on the house. They were kind and welcoming. The sushi was beautifully presented, so very pretty and tasted great. I definitely will go back!
author: Christina K.

description:
I've been going to this restaurant for years....even though their ownership changed and their food is not as tasty as it used to be many, many years ago----I still like to dine in once in a while!  

They are still the only one so far that I've found, that makes their teriyaki sauce thick and sweet---great with even plain old rice!  
Their sushi is delicate and about the right proportion---if you're adventurous and like spicy food---then go for the bay scallop sushi (I think that's the right name) It's hot----but delicious!!! If you don't know what to choose, then you can always go for their bento box dinner/lunch.

Service is not too bad--- they used to leave a whole pot of tea at your table, but nowadays...they just come by  often enough to refill it for you.  The waitresses are fairly nice and attentive---but you might not want to go there if  you're really really hungry---cause sometimes it may take quite a while for your food to get served!
author: Dee L.

description:
I'm not sure what I want to write about Balboa Teriyaki.  

Their teriyaki is good, yes, but it's also a mirage.  It's not the highlight of the restautant.

The reason to come to Balboa Teriyaki is their inexpensive, quality sushi.

Never go there if you are in a hurry.  Sushi orders commonly take thirty to forty minutes. (Sometimes more.)  This is something we know going in, and our experience is always enjoyable.

If you do not know this, your experience may not be.

It's entertainment, really, for some of us.  We regulars.  We watch you check your watch repeatedly.  We watch you look around the restaurant like inattentive puppies.

Are you expecting your order to come from the entrance?

It won't.  It will come from the kitchen.  When it comes, we know it will be amazing.

The highlight for us is when one of you gets so irritated you leave.  We don't like it when you act disrespectfully toward the staff.  It's not their fault, after all.  And to let you know, they will only laugh at you after you've left if you were rude.

Then they'll approach us.  We regulars.

We have extra salmon . . . extra tuna . . . you want?

Of course we want.

Sit back at Balboa Teriyaki.  Order the large Sapporo and a couple of appetizers.  Sit back and wait.  You will be rewarded.
author: Marco L.

description:
OH HELLZ YEAH!!

Just went here yesterday and they had renovated the place and the menu is a little different. Prices have gone up a little too.

The Poki salad is to die for and the Dinner Bento boxes are great! I usually get the Unagi Teriyaki and Salmon Teriyaki Dinner! MMMMMMMMMM SOOO GOOD!

The sushi is very good. I like the hotategai nigiri! Melts right in your mouth! The spicy scallop and tuna hand rolls were great! Lots of great rolls to try and so little time! 

Very nice waitresses and great service!

Parking is ok, food is great! I need to go back soon!
author: Marc E.

description:
Unfortunately, I have to add to the chorus of concern and disappointment over the decline in service quality since the new management and renovation. The sushi still tastes pretty good , although the poki roll has gotten unpleasantly more spicier than it used to be. It seems redundant to even put wasabi.  And just be careful not to order any rolls with cream cheese, because for some reason this place likes to OD on cream cheese, and what's the point then?

But the service has definitely and positively gone down tremendously. FOOD TAKES FOREVER TO ARRIVE. And, as recently as last night, we didn't get our menus in a fortnight. Balboa Teriyaki, you've made me resort to using a word like "fortnight". Not cool. 

The staff remains polite, but you can tell they are constantly falling behind and it shows in how forced their attentiveness is expressed. And anyway, what the heck do the Japanese thing of we quaint Americans who like to to load our sushi with things like cream cheese and deep fried fish? (Not that I'm complaining, because from time to time I do like those kinds of things for sushi. I just like to amuse myself imagining what our Rising Sun counterparts must think.) In any case, my former stellar recommendation for this place has dwindled into grudging approval. It's nearby, it has sushi, so meh. Why not.
author: Joseph R.

description: Sometimes it's more important for me to seated right away and relax in mellow place than it is to fight the crowds, wait for a table and deal with noise.  I hate waiting for a table, so I popped in here and had a decent meal.  Since I live nearby, I would definitely come here again because the prices were pretty good and the food was OK.
author: Sue U.

description: Another good outer Richmond lunch spot! The veggie gyoza and miso soup are great here.
author: Kimi W.

description:
very nice and non expensive sushi place.
i go there any time i'm in that area
author: DImitry G.

description: The portions here are really big.  The food is awesome.  I had a bento box with tempura, salmon teriyaki, and chicken katsu.  Its about 13 bucks with rice, soup, and salad.  Usually, boxes have small portions of all the different selections, but each had plenty.  And it was delicious.
author: Thom Y.

description: I don't find many decent sushi restaurants that give many appetizers on the house (sometimes rolls) every time I stop by. The rolls are served in large portions and the sashimi is always decent (and huge). I know that I can probably go somewhere where the fish is slightly better but in smaller portions. I wouldn't take a date here but I'd definitely go with friends to fill up on sushi goodness.
author: Roth E.

description: I've been back half a dozen times or so in the past two months and each time, the food was super good and the owner (?) gave us a bunch of stuff (i.e. miso soup, edamame, sushi rolls, appetizers) on the house.  I also like that they have a lot of vegetarian friendly dishes that are actually tasty.  Balboa Teriyaki has definitely become one of my favorite Japanese restaurants in the city.
author: Katelynn L.

description: I've been here a few times. It's close to home. Nothing special or outstanding here. There is a definite hint of Korean flavor to their food.
author: Kevo M.

description: solid neighborhood japanese for combination of rolls, cooked entrees, etc.
author: SF D.

description: I used to eat here a lot but they put up their prices too much. The food was good but we don't like paying so much for a quick dinner. Service was always good. We prefer to get Japanese food elsewhere now.
author: S E.

description: We wandered in one day after Dumpling King was busy hosing out their kitchen or some shit, and now we still have never been to Dumpling King cause this place is fantastic! Their sashimi has the giantest cuts of fish and we absolutely freaking love the service there. I usually get chefs choice sashimi, but the other day I ordered a softshell crab and some baked oysters and it was all excellent. I get a different saki every time, and the green tea ice cream really makes my day. I'm going there right now. Then to the Hockey Haven!
author: Lisa M.

description:
hubby introduced me to one of his lunchtime spots during the workweek - nothing fancy, just a simple spot for grabbing a quick sushi/tempura/teriyaki fix.  typical japanese resto decor - not as barebones as akagi's, and the booths are a nice touch.

a decent rendition of the namesake dish (beef in this case), as well as mixed tempura - not overly battered or greasy, a plus.  also solid sushi rolls; the shrimp tempura rolls are much larger than you'd get at most places but the rice to filling ratio is also a bit high.  

prices are pretty low...all in all, not someplace to go out of your way for but a solid go-to place if you're in the area.
author: Jen P.

description:
I have no idea what everyone's talking about when it comes to their customer service. In my Japanese class we're currently learning Kego, which is an extremely polite version of the Japanese language. While we were learning it, my Japanese teacher told us that in restaurants (or in any form of retail)  the service treats you like gods (kami, in Japanese hehe). I felt that the customer service was exactly how my teacher described it. Our server was very polite, checked in with us, and even offered us things on the house (which I'll explain later!!) plus more. To those who had an issue with their customer service, I say give them another chance. Who knows, maybe they fired the person who served you guys? 
Anyways, I went here with my boyfriend and two of my roommates to celebrate the end of a very dramatic house issue that won't be described in this review. We wanted sushi and something close by, and I didn't really like the sushi place across the street from this restaurant so I told them that place was out of the question. So, we went here! I was kind of afraid that Balboa Teriyaki wasn't going to be good because the place was empty, but in the end I was so glad I stayed! 
We were sat down immediately (the place was empty, why wouldn't we be??) and given really pretty menus. Off the top of my head we all ordered: 1 Kirin Ichiban, 1 Sapporo beer, Veggi Tempura, Cherry blossom roll, and three other rolls I can't remember...! Mine came last, which made me kind of sad, but it was still very good (mine was the Cherry Blossom Roll). The food was soooo good, and not uber expensive. Great for a group of in-college/fresh out of college kids who just wanna have a good time! 
And a good time we had, we enjoyed the music, kind of embarrassed a couple at the other table (though the guy said something really embarrassing anyways and we just kinda made him realize that.) and definitely the free food the server was throwing our way. One of my roommates is vegan, so she had to ask for very specific things. Our waiter was VERY helpful, she went back and forth to the kitchen to ask if they had any vegan friendly ingredients for her Tempura, and she ever offered us Edamame on the house. At the end of our dinner she even gave us green tea ice cream on the house! This was SO unnecessary, it wasn't like we were unsatisfied with our food or anything and she still gave us ice cream. This place rocks, hands down. Service, decor, food. Balboa Teriyaki, you're awesome! ;D
author: Allie W.

description: My husband and I enjoy eating here often. We especially like the spicy, salmon, "tiger roll" and the fresh, lemony, salmon "49er roll". My favorite is the delicious chicken teri don. They usually offer a nice green tea ice cream on the house, after you're done with your meal. The service is quite friendly and attentive.
author: Irene P.

description:
I love this sushi place!!! I love it so much that when i used to live in NY and come to SF to visit this would be the first place I would  come and eat at.  The service is great and so is the food. I love the specialty rolls. I am not such a fan of the Teriyaki though. The Hawaiian roll, tiger roll and dragon roll are my top three.  They are  awesome!!!!
The only issue is that they are a bit pricey but such a yummy treat.
author: susa w.

description: I live like 2 blocks away from this restaurant. I am picky when it comes to Japanese restaurants. This place I will always go back to. There food is fresh. Korean owners I believe. The SPICY TUNA ROLL is actually spicy. I always order the SPICY TUNA ROLL, it's my favorite and so far this place does it for me. They make it SPICY. I also always order the Tonkatsu (Pork culet) which is also good. Not any fat on the meat. There Miso soup is also very good, you can taste a little bit of Korean style in it. Bean paste. There other sushi items are also good.  The waiter is also very nice.
author: Ge I.

description: I like this place - a lot. First of all, I think the prices are reasonable and second it's close and I can do carry-out. I'm not a big sushi eater, but their Bay Scallop Roll is really good and spicy. I'm a big sukiyaki fan and theirs is quite reasonable, especially in their combo dinner with tempura (only $11.95).  The only issue I have is that sometimes I leave with the smell of food in my clothes. It may be due to their poor ventilation, so I take away one star. Otherwise it has 5.
author: Natalie S.

description:
their menu is like a freakin bible. its massive, unlike their food.

pretty high prices for some mediocre food, and the small servings don't help.

take a few steps east, and go to the Japanese place next to Chino's instead.
author: Darrell L.

description: I tried this place a while back and it's good food if I can recall correctly, but  honestly nothing really drawled me back here for about a year now. I eat around the area a lot, so it's not out of the way for me. It's simply nothing to go crazy over. If you do try it, I think you would enjoy it because it's one of the better restaurants in the area.
author: David M.

description: I've been coming to this place since it first opened.  They have changed ownership since, but the food is still consistently good.  I always get their sushi and tempura.  I have also gotten their teriyaki plates on several occasions, and it's also very good.  The sauce is thick which is how I like it.  Some places have their sauces thinned out which I don't like so much.  This place is a mom & pop joint, where all the locals and residents in the area goes to for their teriyaki or sushi fix.  If you live in the area, or happen to be in the area, definitely recommend you stopping by.
author: Shi U.

description: Great prices, super yummy rolls, good nigiri sushi (i had sake and hamachi), tasty tempura, nice hot green toasted-rice tea filled to the brim in a silver colored teapot... mmmm....  All-in-all, it was the perfect dinner before seeing a  vintage samurai movie at Balboa Theater.  The price-to-quantity can't be beat, and it was a nice bright place to cozy-down into a booth with some friends on a cold night.  The service was simple, meager almost, and all the food (even the so-called tempura "appetizers") came at once after a bit of a wait, but who cares after taking one bite (and after seeing the awesomely reasonable bill)?  I'll go back.
author: Today Y.

description:
For the past few months I've ordered once a week from Balboa Teriyaki. Come here for the Teriyaki (especially beef) NOT the sushi (unless it's Tekka Maki, Spicy Maki or California roll with real crab meat- remember to specify REAL crab meet). For my teriyaki and two sushi rolls the bill usually comes to be around $24- which I think is on the inexpensive side for Japanese food.
   
Remember T-E-R-I-Y-A-K-I, not S-U-S-H-I.
author: Samantha F.

description: We used to come here for inexpensive Japanese food, but that ship has sailed.  Apparently, the restaurant has changed owners, but the name and sign remains the same.  The food is not the same...  The fish slices on the sushi were HUGE, and not a good thing... Bigger, is not always better.  The tempura was panko crusted, not traditional, and the teriyaki sauce was a sticky, goopy mess.  Service was pleasant, but I don't think we'll be back.  It wasn't terrible, but there are too many other choices.
author: Collin W.

description: I have been here a few times, but recently I had dinner and it was surprisingly good!  The previous times I've eaten here the food was so-so, but I think they must have changed cooks or the menu or their standards because the food and the service was great.  Their mackerel was served with a ton of bones in it, almost to the point it was more work than it was worth which is why I could only give the three stars.
author: Violet S.

description: After a matinee at the Balboa Theatre had a craving for sukiyaki on foggy, cold night and got my wish here. Found out about it because a woman I work with said this is her son's favorite restaurant because of the flavor and the volume served here. You won't go starving. It is very low key, family style...korean-familyrunkindaplace.
author: miriam b.

description:
While this place is your run-of-the-mill Japanese restaurant, it is still a great place to frequent. I have had great rolls and mediocre rolls when I have been here. I have had hurriedly prepared food when I have come in after 9:30PM and I have had awesomely prepared food when I have come in during usual business hours. This is entirely understandable because when you are a half-hour away from closing, the last thing you want to do is work. That's life.
I love the Sabayaki here. It is delicious. Much better than the Sabayaki I had at Kitaro. Not that Kitaro is the end all and be all of Japanese in the city, but there you go. The portions are very big. The tempura is well done and I love that they have Agedashi Tofu on the menu. Their rolls are good and I love the dinner bento specials. They have so many great combos and choices that is hard to pick what to have. I love their little cucumber salads dressed with rice vinegar and sesame seeds!
The wait staff has always been friendly and attentive. Again, if you go in right before closing, I am sure it is a different experience. Also, the food comes in a timely manner. I am not sure how fast people want their food prepared, but it takes time to cook and I would rather have food that is cooked well than have it rushed to my table.
So, yes. This is a good place to go before or after a movie at the Balboa Theatre and while the food is not amazing, it is definitely delicious and satisfying. It's become a regular habit for me and my partner because the food is good, prices reasonable and they have some nice booths.
author: Desiree V.

description:
Admittedly we were the last patrons before closing, but this will now and forever go down as the worst meal I have ever paid for in the City and County of San Francisco.

My Tonkatsu was unrecognizable as such, involved what I am certain to be a microwaved egg (?), and had no redeeming quality. None.

One star for the server's smile.

Adjectives to describe this meal:

Soggy
Unrecognizable
Microwaved
Sweet
Puzzling
author: r g.

description: The teriyaki? Not great. If I didn't live so close, I certainly wouldn't make a trip. But the tempura is nice, the tea, soup and salad tasty. The sushi does the job. You'll never write home about anything you eat here, but it's intimate and pleasant. I like the price and I like the proxmity to the Balboa Theater. So, yeah, it'll totally do.
author: Martha S.

description: I love Balboa Teriyaki. I've been going there for years. Heck I took my soon to be future wife there on our first date. There's really nothing like a nice bowl of Tempura Udon followed by a film at the Balboa Theatre.
author: Brian B.

description: 9pm , six people, tuesday night.  They were able to do it.  We were there for an hour and easily spent over $200.  Bento box and sapporro beer.  Rock on.  I do want to say.  Easily the cleanest toliet I have ever gone too.  And I noticed 100% on their health inspection.  Nice one guys.  I do want to add that I spend alot of time in restaurants and cafes.  An incredible amount.
author: Nick T.

description: Solid. I've never had a bad experience. The price is right.
author: SF N.

description: My dad, a notorious cheapskate, took me here for lunch.  The $8.50 box lunch was a screaming deal and amazing, and even more amazing was the fact that my cheapskate dad found a place that was good and cheap.  The service was incredible.  We had our box, soup, complimentary prawns and edamame within ten minutes of arriving.  The tempura was something I now crave.  My son and family went with me next time and the service was even better, if that's possible.  My husband went with me a few days after that and even though it was after 3:30 pm they allowed us to pay at lunch prices, and again, it was an amazing lunch.  I just went there again today with my sister and a bunch of family.  We got complimentary prawns, edamame, green tea ice cream, and they didn't mind all our loud laughing.  I love this place.  I can't speak highly enough.  Everything's awesome, especially the tempura and sashimi.
author: Jill B.

description: I moved into the neighborhood a few months ago and have eaten here a few times already.  It's always been good sushi (had terriyaki once too) and nice service.  I will say I wish they cut the sushi pieces smaller.  Both times we come in kinda late at night, between 9-10p and had no problems.  We like it a lot and will be back many times I'm sure.
author: Shauna C.

description: the spicy tuna hand roll with avocado is absolutely amazing. good food, good prices, and the owner is very cool.
author: Alex F.

description: I'm usually more conservative with my stars, but I really do like this place for lunch. I miss the waitress that went to work somewhere else though. She was a real pro. That being said, the service is good and the food tasty, albeit standard fare. The fish is too cold though. I usually have to take it off the top and soak it in the shoyu to warm it up. The hamachi is nice and fatty. Saba is standard (I tend to judge by the saba)  prices are very reasonable. It is dependable
author: tregar o.

description: i dont understand the lettuce in the spider rolls.  however, they're only 4 bucks and taste alright, so i'm alright, and they're alright.
author: Nora B.

description: ok sushi, not the best. bad service. had to wait for my food forever, asked for a few simple things like soybeans, never received even though not that busy, asked again and never received. waitresses had an attitude problem, no smile, werent attentive to customers, overall bad experience!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Emily G.

description: My husband and I used to go there at least once a week years ago.  But when our favorite waitress quit, the menu bulked up with sushi selections, things just went downhill.  I decided to give it another chance while in the neighborhood, after 4 years.  Things did not improve.  I got a teriyaki lunch combination.  The soup and tempura were good.  But my chicken looked like it was re-heated from the night before.  Tasteless.  Skimpy teriyaki sauce.  Just like previous review, I, too, loved their thick teriyaki sauce.  I really don't know what happened...the cook looks like the same person from before so I am surprised there has been a change in food quality.  Maybe dinners are better...
author: G. W.

description: I went here for dinner on a Sunday night before a movie at the Balboa. I'm glad to have found a nice Japanese place in my neighborhood. I am not an expert on Japanese cuisine, but everything tasted very good.  It was not crowded, but there was a decent number of people there eating and the place had a good atmosphere - not fancy, but not "fast foody". The interior is well done in a Japanese style and is peacful and pleasant. For around $12 I had the dinner bento box, which offered a good variety from the menu and was enough that I took some home for lunch the next day. They offered salad, miso soup and rice with it, and the bento box consists of tempura, edamame pods, and your choice of 2 or 3 other items. I am not a big fan of tempura, but this was well done by my standards. And I *am* a fan of sushi, so I'll have to go back and try their offerings. Plus, living out here in the fog bank, I often get cravings for huge steaming hot bowls of udon, so this place will probably be my go-to.
author: Caitlin H.

description: This is my all time favorite Japanese restaurant. They always perfect all their dishes. Great place for sushi combo. great price. Teriyaki beef is served just right, soft and tender- not overcooked.  I have been there many times, and never been disappointed.
author: Jen C.

description: Went for lunch the other day and was quite impressed by the service and the free stuff they gave us. We ordered bento boxes which were quite reasonable and pretty good. The tempura was great, the beef teriyaki was better than the chicken teriyaki, but both were good. They give you edamame to begin with. Then we got complimentary deep fried shrimp on skewers. These were the kind with shell and head, but you can eat everything since it's deep fried. It was very good. Next came our bento boxes where the portions are pretty generous for a lunch special. They then brought out a full order of spicy tuna rolls. Again, we didn't order these, but they said they were on-the-house. Once we finished, they brought out green tea ice cream. We were stuffed. The service was great. They always came around to fill-up our tea cups on a regular basis. They even asked if i wanted more miso soup. Their service really raised my expectations, and anything less will be a disappointment now. We will definitely be back to try dinner, and see if they can match the great lunch experience we had.
author: David Y.
